Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




Cheil Worldwide is a full-service agency from brand building to digital transformations creating excellent data-driven experiences for every customer. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Spain plays its part in one of the world‚Äôs biggest agency networks ‚Äì comprising 53 offices and 8 affiliates in 43 countries globally with more than 6.000 employees and 600 clients around the world. Cheil Spain is made up of 100 employees from different disciplines, who are passionate about innovation in all its forms. We offer a wide variety of marketing and advertising services, including strategy and planning, creative, content production, traditional and digital media advertising, influencer marketing, event marketing, e-commerce and performance marketing, among others.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Analyst




‚úîÔ∏è What we are looking for?




We are looking for a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Performance team at Cheil Spain. This role will play a critical part in unlocking insights from web and CRM data to improve user experiences, increase conversions, and inform strategic decisions for Samsung Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate has strong expertise in Adobe Analytics and GA4, and a solid understanding of user behavior analysis, segmentation, and digital marketing KPIs. Bonus if you're familiar with SQL, Python, BigQuery, and Qlik.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Responsibilities:




Support CRM and performance initiatives through audience segmentation, behavior analysis, and campaign performance reporting.
Evaluate Campaigns, promotions, marketing channels attribution, the funnel, and much more for the understanding of the customer journey, identifying insights with clear business recommendations
Analyze user journeys and web behavior through Adobe Analytics and GA4 to identify performance trends, drop-offs, and optimization opportunities.
Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Adobe Workspace, Looker Studio, or Power BI to track performance and support internal and client decision-making.
Collaborate closely with UX, CRO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to align data strategies and contribute with actionable insights.
Define KPIs and measurement frameworks for digital marketing initiatives and validate technical tracking implementations (with support from GTM specialists if needed).
Deliver recurring and ad hoc reports for always-on and campaign-based activities, including funnel analysis, campaign attribution, and ecommerce performance.
Present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, connecting data findings with business objectives.
Continuously monitor data quality, track implementation, and propose process improvements to strengthen data-driven decision-making.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Skills & requirements:




4+ years in a Digital Data Analyst role, ideally within an agency or ecommerce environment.
Advanced expertise in Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics 4.
Proven ability to extract, visualize, and present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience building dashboards and reports using Looker Studio or Power BI.
Strong understanding of digital marketing campaigns, ecommerce KPIs, and data quality validation.
Excellent storytelling and presentation skills in PowerPoint.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a strategic business mindset.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python for data querying and automation tasks.
Understanding of website tagging and event tracking via Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager or other CDP tools.
Previous exposure to e-commerce platforms and CRO/UX concepts.
Familiarity with A/B testing frameworks and marketing attribution models.
Fluent in Spanish and English.




Languages:

C1 level of English required, with advanced English writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with international teams and external suppliers.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Candee, consultora de talento, estamos gestionando esta posici√≥n de Junior Data Analyst para Ufinet üåé.




¬øQu√© es UFINET? üîé




Ufinet es un operador mayorista de telecomunicaciones. Con m√°s de 27 a√±os de experiencia, ha desplegado m√°s de 130.000 km de fibra √≥ptica con una amplia cobertura de red en las principales ciudades de 17 pa√≠ses, principalmente de Am√©rica Latina.

Pretenden proporcionar conectividad a trav√©s de fibra √≥ptica de la manera m√°s flexible y √°gil, siempre con un alto compromiso con sus clientes.

Con valores integrados de flexibilidad, agilidad, pasi√≥n, compromiso o proximidad, tienen la visi√≥n de ser el operador neutral de telecomunicaciones de referencia a nivel mundial.




¬øQu√© hace que UFINET sea un sitio √∫nico? üòç




Seg√∫n nos ha contado el equipo de UFINET, lo mejor de trabajar aqu√≠ es:

ü§ùTrabajo en equipo: Un ambiente de compa√±erismo, respeto y apoyo mutuo. Aqu√≠ todos reman en la misma direcci√≥n, se celebran los logros juntos y se superan los retos en equipo.

üåé Crecimiento: UFINET es una empresa en plena expansi√≥n, lo que se traduce en oportunidades constantes para evolucionar profesionalmente.

üí°Aprendizaje: Oportunidad de aprender constantemente nuevas tecnolog√≠as y habilidades dando soluciones a proyectos y problemas reales.




¬øC√≥mo ser√° tu equipo? üëØ




Formar√°s parte del equipo de Software y Data, bajo el liderazgo de su Chief Data Officer. El equipo tiene una l√≠nea de Data Analysis y una l√≠nea de Data Engineering liderado por sus respectivos Team Leads y dentro de los cu√°les los perfiles est√°n especializados en las diferentes √°reas de negocio.

Formar√°s parte del equipo de Data Analysts, quienes te acompa√±ar√°n en tu desarrollo como analista de datos.




¬øCu√°l ser√° tu misi√≥n? üöÄ




Tu misi√≥n ser√° dar soporte al equipo de analistas de datos y aprender y colaborar con todo lo necesario para realizar una visualizaci√≥n y an√°lisis efectivo de datos.

Dar soporte en la extracci√≥n, limpieza y estructuraci√≥n (ETL) de datos desde diferentes fuentes.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst plays a crucial role in consolidating, analyzing, and optimizing operational and financial reporting across multiple countries. This role ensures accurate data insights for process improvements and acts as a bridge between IT and operational teams. Additionally, the Senior Analyst serves as a Project Management Office (PMO) coordinator, ensuring smooth project execution and process documentation. The position also involves developing and delivering interactive training sessions to enhance data literacy and process understanding within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, consolidate, and analyze reports from multiple regions to identify trends and performance gaps.
Develop data visualization dashboards and user-friendly reporting tools to improve decision-making.
Identify key data trends and detect anomalies (red flags), providing corrective action recommendations.
Collaborate with IT to ensure process flows are aligned with system capabilities and automation strategies.
Act as a PMO coordinator, tracking project timelines, milestones, and resource allocations.
Document operational processes, ensuring clear and structured process flows.
Support change management initiatives, driving seamless adoption of new systems and reporting structures.
Design and deliver interactive training sessions to enhance data analytics capabilities across teams.
Conduct workshops and hands-on sessions to ensure proper use of reporting tools and dashboards.
Travel regionally to support teams in implementing new data-driven initiatives and provide on-site training when needed.




Qualifications & Experience:

Degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in multinational environments, handling regional data reporting and analytics.
Strong expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and Power BI.
Background in project management, process documentation, and training facilitation.
Familiarity with finance, business analysis, or operational performance tracking.
Fluent English required; additional languages are a plus.




Key Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
High proficiency in data visualization and reporting.
Experience in process improvement and workflow optimization.
Strong project management and change management skills.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across different teams and cultures.
Capability to design and conduct training programs, using interactive methodologies to engage learners.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
@ Team Panthr

Expect the unexpected!

We are the first zero-BS talent matchmaker. Empowering individuals through their job seeking journey whilst finding the perfect candidate that fits not only a role but a company vision.

From start to finish, we focus on making the recruitment process smooth and positive for everyone involved.

With more than 15 years of experience in the field, we make use of real data insights, professional expertise and technology. Although we offer worldwide service, our feet are always on the ground and trust is at the heart of what we do, built on transparency and a genuine commitment to seeing you succeed.

Meet our client

Our Client is CONFIDENTIAL

About The Role

A globally renowned bank is seeking a Data Analyst to work on a key transformation initiative following a recent technology merger. The role focuses on data rationalisation, mapping, and modelling across banking and holding systems, contributing to the development of a new data hub and central data warehouse.

Key Responsibilities


Define and help implement business/information system solutions across complex financial platforms.
Lead data mapping, transformation, and flow identification across large datasets.
Deep-dive analysis on data from multiple financial sources.
Collaborate with stakeholders to rationalise and streamline data architecture.
Support the build of a central data warehouse and data hub.
Document and analyse data models and ensure alignment with system integration needs.


About You


Extensive experience in data analysis, mapping, and transformation in large-scale environments.
Strong skills in SQL and experience with Oracle databases.
Proficiency in data modelling and understanding of the software development life cycle.
Solid exposure to financial systems (e.g., FX, Capital Markets) and strong financial product knowledge.
Prior experience with Murex is highly desirable.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description



We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are
At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionize digital advertising.

Your Challenge

You will propose a new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding.
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasping the attention of the public and transmitting complex information into simple explanations.
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients.
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc).
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales to marketing to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day.
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and actively propose improvements together with the Product Team.
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics-related field.
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must.
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative solutions.
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English.
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment.
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills.
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment.
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!
It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company off-sites, and more!

Additional Perks
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage is included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV, and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process, and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst, News, Partnerships, Compliance Ops
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Math, Quantitative Science, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience working in data analytics, consulting, data science, engineering, or a technical operations role.
6 years of experience in statistical problem solving and analyzing data sets using SQL or comparable coding language (e.g. Python, R, Java, C++).
3 years of experience working in data analytics, consulting, data science, engineering, or a technical operations role.
Experience in analyzing data using spreadsheet software or building data pipelines and automated workflows.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, etc.).
5 years of experience with designing experiments, developing statistical models, measurement, and identifying business opportunities.
Experience with data analysis.
Experience in influencing executive leadership on investigative decision making.
Ability to effectively communicate analysis and recommendations across a wide range of non-technical audiences.
Ability to solve problems in complex, fluid, and ambiguous business environments through solid data intuition and business acumen.


About The Job

Google's leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges, and members of BizOps work in small teams to find solutions. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis, and then zoom out to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives, roll-up your sleeves to help drive implementation and check back-in to see the impact of your recommendations.

News Partnerships (NP) manages partnerships for Google‚Äôs News‚Äô products and programs. These partnerships take many forms - premium content licensing, product integrations, consultative engagements to Digitally Transform or running innovation workshops to develop new solutions with the Industry.

In this role, you will work with News Partnerships‚Äô leadership team to develop partnership and program strategies, build and align operating priorities, and drive compliance globally. You are a critical thinker, influencer, and leader with expertise in simplifying complexity and managing scaled programs at pace.

The Global Partnerships organization is responsible for exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Google‚Äôs Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The Global Partnerships team supports Google‚Äôs own Product teams with essential partnerships to help Google‚Äôs user experiences in advertising, Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping, Payments and more. Teams create product-enabling partnerships, go-to-market strategies and incubate business growth for a variety of products.

Responsibilities


Work with various data sources, including large datasets (structured and unstructured) and CRM systems to get actionable insights from vast data sources and develop solutions for compliance for News Partnerships.
Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Partnerships, Engineering, and Legal to update data requirements, create reports, and provide insights.
Build and evaluate models for News compliance.
Enhance the operational workflows, tools and systems via data analysis, technical expertise, and efficient process improvements.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingenier√≠a ¬°este es tu pr√≥ximo destino!

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Contact Center Operations
Description:
Company Description

At MSX International, a North American multinational and leading consultancy for the automotive industry, we have over 500 experts in Spain and Portugal dedicated to developing and implementing innovative solutions that enhance our clients' business processes and outcomes.

With more than 25 years of industry experience, our multilingual and multicultural Contact Center operates with a proactive and dynamic approach. Our diverse team consistently contributes ideas, makes informed decisions, and collaborates to ensure each client feels unique and fully satisfied with our exceptional service.

Today, our team comprises over 170 professionals, and thanks to our commitment to excellence, we continue to grow!

Job Description

Do you have a passion for data analytics and making sense of complex information?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and support our Contact Center operations. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain data models and dashboards, delivering actionable insights into customer data. This technical position is key to driving decision-making and identifying new opportunities to enhance performance.

Key Responsibilities


Design and develop KPI dashboards to enhance decision-making and performance tracking.
Leverage data mining techniques and reporting tools to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Prepare analytics reports in a clear and professional presentation format.
Collaborate on establishing effective data ETL practices and processes.
Conduct research and analyze ad-hoc studies as required.
Document process flows and business rules, ensuring up-to-date and accurate records.
Process and analyze large datasets, keeping current reports updated and relevant.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in fast-paced industries like automotive or similar businesses preferred.
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Proficiency in SQL for querying relational databases.
Expertise in data manipulation, complex analysis, and statistical modeling.
Excellent analytical skills to interpret and communicate data insights effectively.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with ETL tools (e.g., SSIS, Alteryx, KNIME).
Familiarity with Training, Learning, Development, or Talent Management teams.
Strong multitasking, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented with a proactive and solutions-driven mindset.
Full professional proficiency in English is required.
Ability to perform advanced statistical analysis.


Additional Information

What we offer:


Be part of a great team of professionals in an internationally consolidated company.
MSX Bazaar: A collective purchasing portal with fantastic discounts for employees.
The possibility to join the Flexible Compensation Plan (including medical insurance, transport card, meal card, training, and more).
23 working days of vacation per year, as stipulated by the collective agreement.
Additional incentives such as employee referral programs, opportunities as internal trainers, recognition for new business contributions, and more.
You will be working from our Madrid office in a 50% hybrid position, with the first 5-6 months approx. fully on-site for the adaptation period. Our office is located at C. de Albasanz, 15, San Blas-Canillejas, 28037 Madrid.
Salary: ‚Ç¨30,000 gross per year.


MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Mira

Mira is a San Francisco-based hormonal health company providing integrative care and hormonal testing for over 92,000 customers. In 2023, they were recognized by Inc. 5000 as America's fastest-growing femtech company. We started our company to help women and individuals reach their parenthood dreams and make their fertility journey smoother.

Mira‚Äôs most important breakthrough was inventing the market's only FDA-compliant at-home fertility monitor with quantitative technology. Since the beginning, they have been on a mission to develop data-driven hormonal health solutions to help women make confident health decisions during every stage of their lives‚Äîfrom the menstrual stage to menopause. Mira offers solutions to test, boost, and navigate fertility‚Äîstarting from comprehensive hormone testing and supplements to fertility coaching and online courses.

We are committed to helping our customers achieve the highest possible success rates and outcomes; that is why our focus is on personalized care, the use of the most cutting-edge technology, and science-backed data.

About The Position

We are looking for a part-time Marketing Data Analyst **to enhance Mira‚Äôs decision-making processes through advanced data analysis and actionable insights. The ideal candidate is experienced in marketing analytics, e-commerce sector, and data visualization through Looker.

The role is a remote position, with a 20-hour workweek, flexible working hours and occasional overlap with the US team. There is potential for the role to evolve into a full-time position based on performance and company needs in 2-3 months.

If want to challenge yourself at a high-growth startup and make a difference for women's health please join us!

Responsibilities


Leverage Looker to create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide a holistic view of performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
Provide actionable insights to drive marketing strategy, optimize campaign performance, and improve customer acquisition and retention.
Collaborate with marketing & retention teams to understand their data needs, own and prioritize the roadmap, and deliver tailored insights and recommendations.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in both performance marketing and e-commerce metrics.
Data Governance - ensure the data is flowing seamlessly between the website and third party tools, troubleshoot is necessary.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Business, or similar). Master's degree is a plus.
2+ years in a Marketing Data & Insights role.
High proficiency with Looker and GA4.
High proficiency with Excel and Big Query.
Experience in e-commerce or consumer brands with a strong emphasis on customer acquisition and digital marketing.
Knowledge of DTC Marketing Analytics, A/B testing; familiarity with Python or SQL is a plus.
Strong data storytelling abilities, as well as the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience.
Inherent curiosity and analytical follow-through - you can‚Äôt help but ask ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù and love using data and logic to explore potential solutions.


What We Offer


You will work with a dedicated, highly-engaged, international team of professionals who are passionate about helping couples and individuals start their families
We have a fast paced and collaborative work environment where we encourage open communication, ownership and independence
In addition to competitive salary we offer performance-based bonus system based on OKR
We provide professional development opportunities - training courses, workshops and seminars


Recruiting process

Step 1 ‚ÄòScreening call with HR‚Äô - Step 2 ‚ÄòAssessment task‚Äô - Step 3 ‚ÄòInterview with the Head of Growth‚Äô - Step 4 ‚ÄòFinal interview with CMO‚Äô
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Auctane, we are united by a passion to help businesses deliver ‚Äî whatever their size, wherever they are, and however they operate. We make it possible for businesses to meet the ever-changing requirements of their industry and customer expectations. Auctane products enable hundreds of thousands of businesses to annually mail and ship billions of items ‚Äî over $200 billion worth ‚Äî to recipients around the globe.

The Auctane family of mailing and shipping software products includes ShipStation, Stamps.com, ShipStation API, Endicia, Metapack, GlobalPost, Packlink, and Return Rabbit. Our partners include Amazon, UPS, USPS, eBay, BigCommerce, Shopify, WooCommerce, and Walmart.

Our values

Win as One. Delight Customers. Deliver Great Outcomes.

About The Team

The Analytics team supports key business decision making through the delivery of actionable insights based on accurate data to stakeholders across the Auctane e-commerce products. These responsibilities are delivered through close collaboration with internal teams, working on the definition & refinement of the KPIs, setting goals against these KPIs, measuring performance against these goals and recommending (and when applicable, implementing) actions to drive improved performance. In addition, the Analytics team leads the delivery of both standardized & ad-hoc reporting, analysis & insights to drive business decisions.

About The Role

The Business Data Analyst at Auctane helps enable data-informed decision-making by developing reporting, performing analyses, and uncovering insights that support business growth, customer experience, and go-to-market execution. Working closely with senior analysts and cross-functional partners in Product, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success, this role focuses on supporting the development of dashboards, reports, and analyses that improve team visibility and decision-making. The role will contribute to strengthening Auctane's analytics capabilities by helping maintain data assets and collaborating with business teams to deliver impactful solutions.

What will you be doing?


Collaborate with engineering and business stakeholders to translate business needs into scalable, data-driven solutions while ensuring alignment and effective communication.
Generate actionable insights to support both strategic initiatives and day-to-day operational execution.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable reporting systems and dashboards, including tactical, strategic, and executive-level views that inform decision-making across Auctane brands.
Develop and maintain KPI reporting for core business areas such as Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success.
Define, implement, and manage key data feeds from internal systems and external partners to support accurate business performance measurement.
Work with large, complex datasets, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and consistency across the pipeline.
Participate in and lead analytic projects from problem definition through analysis to the clear presentation of results.
Promote adoption of analytics tools and reporting standards by delivering impactful reports, providing team training, and championing best practices.
Demonstrate a strategic mindset, simplifying complexity through innovative and scalable analytics solutions that address evolving business needs.


What are we looking for?


Two or more (2+) years experience in data-driven environments with an expert knowledge of SQL and translating complex datasets into clear business insights.
Experience designing and creating dashboards for use by Executives and Analysts.
Strong eye for detail and a passion for quickly delivering results for rapid action.
Comfortable working in a highly collaborative, consensus-oriented environment.
Excellent written, verbal, scientific communication and time management skills.
Data visualization and storytelling: ability to turn complex data into clear insights.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience, as well as the ability to design and deploy clear reporting assets.
Ability to work cross functionally to collaboratively understand and deliver on business needs.
English fluency is required


What will make you stand out?


Strong track record of learning new tools, technologies, and frameworks.
Experience with version control tools such as GitHub for collaborative analytics development.


What do we offer?

üí∏ Clear and transparent compensation plan. The salary range goes from 38000 to 45000‚Ç¨. We will discuss the indicated range with you in the first recruiting call to ensure that we are on the same page.

üí∞ Flexible salary benefits

Save on personal income tax with Cobee for expenses like transport, restaurants, and kindergarten.

ü©∫ Private health insurance

Free for all employees via Cigna, plus we cover 50% for your family members.

üè† Remote-first culture

All Auctane Spain team members work remotely. We support your setup with a ‚Ç¨50 net/month home office allowance (‚Ç¨600/year).

üåÖ Generous time off

Enjoy 26 days of holiday per year (23 base days + your üéÇ birthday off, Christmas Eve, and New Year's Eve).

üíª Your gear, your choice

Whether you prefer Mac or Windows, or need an extra screen, we'll make sure you're set up for success from day one.

üóìÔ∏è Annual Salary Review

We're committed to recognizing your professional growth. Every year, we review salaries to reflect your individual development, achievements, and impact on our business success.

üìô Grow your skills

We offer up to ‚Ç¨2000/year in training (certifications, conferences, workshops) to boost your growth‚Äîboth technical and personal.

üì∫ Learning resources

Access internal and external training, including platforms like LinkedIn Learning, completely free.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Holistic wellness program

Includes access to Wellhub, Curalinc (psychological support), Rocketlawyer (legal advice), and regular health webinars & challenges.

üòä Volunteer day

Take one day off a year to volunteer and give back. Bonus points for sharing pics on Slack!

üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Free therapy vouchers

Because your mental health matters.

üèê Health & wellness support

Get up to ‚Ç¨55/month to cover your gym or fitness classes (yoga, boxing, pilates, etc.).

üó∫Ô∏è Weekly language classes

Improve or learn a new language (English, Spanish, French, Italian, or German) in small groups with expert instructors‚Äîon us!

üè• Time for health

Get 8 hours per year for personal medical appointments and 10 hours per year to support your family's medical needs.

‚öñÔ∏è Work-life balance

We're flexible and people-first. We know life happens, and we aim to make work work for you.

ü©≥ Short Fridays

We work from 8:00 to 15:00 every Friday so you can start your weekend early.

üèñÔ∏è Summer Schedule

From mid-July through August, enjoy reduced summer hours to make the most of your summer.

üíú Inclusive, upbeat culture

No suits here‚Äîjust a welcoming, casual, and respectful space where diversity is celebrated, and you can be your full self.

üåç A global, multicultural team

We're made up of 20+ nationalities, speaking 10+ languages. All communication is in English, so everyone's included.

üì¶ Packlink Pro discount

Enjoy 99% off your personal shipments using our platform.

üîó Referral bonuses

Know someone amazing? Earn ‚Ç¨1K‚Äì‚Ç¨3K when you refer candidates we hire‚Äîdepending on the role.

üè¢ Central Madrid office

When you want a change of scenery, drop by our office in the heart of Madrid‚Äîfree snacks and drinks included!

üèüÔ∏è Team events

We work hard and play hard with regular team-building activities and meetups.

Because your mental health matters.

Title: Mid Data Analyst - Marketing (f/m/x) - Spain
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Data Analyst to join our dynamic Marketing department at AUTO1 Group Technology. Our pioneering team of marketing experts leverages data-driven insights to run efficient performance marketing campaigns and enhance the customer journey. Operating all acquisition marketing and conversion optimization activities fully in-house provides you with the best environment for a steep learning curve. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform, revolutionizing the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Design, Develop, and Maintain our Reports : Work closely with the Marketing, Product, and Business Analytics teams of AUTO1 to enable faster and more insightful decision-making.
Provide stakeholders with data and business insights, follow up on KPIs definitions and implementation
Support Stakeholders with Data Access: Provide analysts and business stakeholders with easy access to well-structured data, fostering a data-driven culture.
Build and enhance data workflows, models and pipelines to support reporting and analytics needs in Tableau.
Ensure Data Quality and Consistency: Implement testing, documentation, and version control practices using Git to maintain high data quality standards.
Consolidate and review existing reports to lift our reporting to a higher level of information density.


Qualifications


Experience: 3+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, business intelligence, analytics engineering or other similar roles
Proficiency in SQL and Data Modeling, understanding of data modeling concepts for data warehousing. Understanding DBT is a plus.
Proficient in Tableau or similar business intelligence tools for data visualization.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and proactively drive projects to completion.
Preferred knowledge of marketing platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, etc.
Collaborative Mindset: Being a great team player comes naturally to you, and you communicate fluently in English.
Proactive Attitude: Highly motivated with a can-do mindset, willing to challenge the status quo and continuously seek improvement.


Additional Information


Education program for online courses, conferences, and training
Your life-work balance is important to us, so you have the option to work in a remote model.
Time to relax: 22 days of vacation per year
We offer discounts on well-known brands like Flaconi, Bosch, Apple, and Sky, as well as special offers on used cars for you, your family, and your friends
More than 90 different nationalities make up a truly international and diverse working environment


Contact

Igor Popov

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data & insights Intern
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data & Insights intern to join our Global eCommerce team of Consumer Business, as part of our digital marketing operations team in Madrid.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we‚Äôre transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we‚Äôre constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we‚Äôre breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As an Insights intern you‚Äôll be responsible for supporting the data and insights team with data analysis in their day to day for our Consumer brands.

We‚Äôre on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What You‚Äôll Do


Understand our business and its processes through our data and apply it to help product and services teams
Create and maintain new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintain and create new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Monthly/Weekly and ad-hoc market analysis and reporting, monitoring the performance of our brand across different markets. Monitor also to competitors and monitoring the news of competing brands.


Your Qualifications


Be a champion in Microsof office (excel and powerpoint mainly)
Have a structured way of working, understand complex processes, and able to explain them in a simple way
Conduct end-to-end analysis and communicate insights effectively
Desired would be experience creating dashboards (with tools like Tableau/PowerBI/Looker etc.)
Eager to learn
Fluent in English


What You‚Äôll Get In Return‚Ä¶

We‚Äôre offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!
Show more

Title: BI Data Analytics Graduate
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
We are looking for talented and passionate graduates within Technology that are interested in an international Tech Graduate Program for one year, you will deep dive into different parts of the business, where you will have the opportunity to experience a global project in an international company.




To summarize, if you have a technical profile and are interested in Technology, there is no doubt you can fit into our organization and learn and grow your experience!




Our Technology Graduate Program is designed to equip recent graduates with the essential skills and knowledge needed to excel in the dynamic field of technology. This intensive program offers a comprehensive combination of hands-on experience, technical training, and professional development opportunities.




Program Highlights:

Practical Projects: Graduates will work on real-world projects under the guidance of experienced mentors. These projects will provide hands-on experience and help develop problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Technical Training: The program includes specialized training sessions on the latest technologies, programming languages, and tools. Participants will have the opportunity to obtain industry-recognized certifications.
Professional Development: In addition to technical skills, the program focuses on developing soft skills such as communication, teamwork, and leadership. Workshops and seminars will be conducted to enhance these competencies.
Mentorship and Networking: Each participant will be paired with a mentor who will provide guidance and support throughout the program. Networking events will also be organized to help graduates connect with industry professionals and peers.
Assessment and Feedback: Regular performance evaluations will be conducted to provide constructive feedback and identify areas for improvement. This ensures continuous development and growth throughout the program.
Career Opportunities: The diverse experience gained during the program will adequately prepare them for various positions in the technology industry.




Responsibilities

The graduate will join different teams inside Data & Analytics in a rotation program that can help him/her to give a global view of the data activities in the company. Among others, will do the following tasks

Participate in different projects in the Data & Analytics teams:
IA projects in the Advance Analytics domain as AIOPs engineer
Data & Structural projects in the Development domain as Data Engineer
Data Governance activities
Take part of the delivery team for go-live tasks
Take part of the support team for different services both in AI and Data Services
Manage the communication with different stakeholders
Document and publish every task relate to his/her work




Requirements

Bachelor or master‚Äôs in Computer science, Software Engineering, telecommunications, or similar.
Fluent in English and Spanish.
Graduation Certificate.




Preferred

Previous international exposure
1 year of work experience or other internships are meriting.







Verisure will offer you:

Hybrid model üè¢ üíª Work from home and at our great Madrid offices in Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n (El Barrial- Centro Comercial)
Lunch included at our canteen üçΩÔ∏è You won‚Äôt need to pay for your daily meal when you are at the office! :)
Dynamic and vibrant environment üí•Our office is an open-plan space in which you will be able to interact with the best professional from different teams at all levels.
Periodic team buildings! üí™ Because it‚Äôs important to have fun!
Learning and training programs

We are looking for talented and passionate graduates within Technology that are interested in an international Tech Graduate Program for one year, you will deep dive into different parts of the business, where you will have the opportunity to experience a global project in an international company.


To summarize, if you have a technical profile and are interested in Technology, there is no doubt you can fit into our organization and learn and grow your experience!


Our Technology Graduate Program is designed to equip recent graduates with the essential skills and knowledge needed to excel in the dynamic field of technology. This intensive program offers a comprehensive combination of hands-on experience, technical training, and professional development opportunities.


Program Highlights:

  • Practical Projects: Graduates will work on real-world projects under the guidance of experienced mentors. These projects will provide hands-on experience and help develop problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
  • Technical Training: The program includes specialized training sessions on the latest technologies, programming languages, and tools. Participants will have the opportunity to obtain industry-recognized certifications.
  • Professional Development: In addition to technical skills, the program focuses on developing soft skills such as communication, teamwork, and leadership. Workshops and seminars will be conducted to enhance these competencies.
  • Mentorship and Networking: Each participant will be paired with a mentor who will provide guidance and support throughout the program. Networking events will also be organized to help graduates connect with industry professionals and peers.
  • Assessment and Feedback: Regular performance evaluations will be conducted to provide constructive feedback and identify areas for improvement. This ensures continuous development and growth throughout the program.
  • Career Opportunities: The diverse experience gained during the program will adequately prepare them for various positions in the technology industry.


Responsibilities

The graduate will join different teams inside Data & Analytics in a rotation program that can help him/her to give a global view of the data activities in the company. Among others, will do the following tasks

  • Participate in different projects in the Data & Analytics teams:
  • IA projects in the Advance Analytics domain as AIOPs engineer
  • Data & Structural projects in the Development domain as Data Engineer
  • Data Governance activities
  • Take part of the delivery team for go-live tasks
  • Take part of the support team for different services both in AI and Data Services
  • Manage the communication with different stakeholders
  • Document and publish every task relate to his/her work


Requirements

  • Bachelor or master‚Äôs in Computer science, Software Engineering, telecommunications, or similar.
  • Fluent in English and Spanish.
  • Graduation Certificate.


Preferred

  • Previous international exposure
  • 1 year of work experience or other internships are meriting.



Verisure will offer you:

  • Hybrid model üè¢ üíª Work from home and at our great Madrid offices in Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n (El Barrial- Centro Comercial)

  • Dynamic and vibrant environment üí•Our office is an open-plan space in which you will be able to interact with the best professional from different teams at all levels.
  • Periodic team buildings! üí™ Because it‚Äôs important to have fun!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gamdom is home to thousands of betting options for both sports and casino players to wager on. Since 2016, we have been steadily growing to provide more than just casino games and sports betting events to enjoy; With us, you can enjoy unique bonuses and earn massive rewards simultaneously. Discover all the rewarding features Gamdom can offer you below.

Gamdom is seeking a Data Analyst with strong technical skills to join our fast-paced data team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of analytics, engineering, and visualization. You'll bring hands-on experience in SQL, Snowflake, and dbt, along with business-facing skills in reporting, dashboard development (using Tableau), and data analysis to drive insights across the company.

The successful candidate will analyze existing reporting logic, collaborate with data engineers to design robust data models and data marts, and build scalable, high-impact Tableau dashboards. You will also support the transition of reports and dashboards to our new Snowflake environment and provide actionable insights to stakeholders across finance, CRM, marketing, and operations.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is independent, proactive, and adaptable‚Äîcomfortable managing their workload, collaborating across teams, and driving solutions forward with minimal supervision. The ideal candidate is passionate about analytics, confident in SQL and data modeling, and experienced in working alongside engineers and analysts to translate business needs into technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze SQL queries in Tableau and Snowflake datasets to extract key KPIs, metrics, and business logic.
Collaborate with data engineers to build robust reporting data models and data marts in Snowflake.
Act as a bridge between stakeholders and data engineering‚Äîgathering requirements, clarifying business definitions, and ensuring accurate metric implementation.
Design, develop, and optimize Tableau dashboards aligned with business needs and performance standards.
Support the migration of reports and dashboards to the new Snowflake environment.
Conduct data analysis to generate actionable insights for finance, CRM, marketing, and operations teams.
Clearly communicate new data models and metrics to BI and data analysts to ensure adoption and consistency.
Provide support for ad hoc data analyses, reporting requests, and broader data initiatives.
Contribute to data governance by documenting definitions, processes, and ensuring consistency across the organization.
Assist in advanced analytics initiatives, such as fraud detection, customer segmentation, churn analysis, and performance tracking.


Required Skills & Competencies


2‚Äì4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within the casino, iGaming, or online entertainment industry.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience with Snowflake and dbt (or similar tools) for data modeling and ETL.
Proficiency in Tableau or similar BI tools (e.g., Power BI), including dashboard design and optimization.
Solid understanding of SQL-based data modeling, warehousing principles, and KPI frameworks.
Ability to work independently, manage competing priorities, and proactively solve problems.
Strong analytical mindset with excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with tools like Jira for backlog and task management (a plus).
Understanding of data privacy considerations in analytics.
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field (preferred).


Why Join Us


Work with a talented, collaborative team on meaningful, high-impact projects.
Help shape the future of analytics in a fast-growing, innovative company.
Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge cloud data platforms and tools.
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and strong opportunities for professional growth.

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Auctane, we are united by a passion to help businesses deliver ‚Äî whatever their size, wherever they are, and however they operate. We make it possible for businesses to meet the ever-changing requirements of their industry and customer expectations. Auctane products enable hundreds of thousands of businesses to annually mail and ship billions of items ‚Äî over $200 billion worth ‚Äî to recipients around the globe.

The Auctane family of mailing and shipping software products includes ShipStation, Stamps.com, ShipStation API, Endicia, Metapack, GlobalPost, Packlink, and Return Rabbit. Our partners include Amazon, UPS, USPS, eBay, BigCommerce, Shopify, WooCommerce, and Walmart.

Our values

Win as One. Delight Customers. Deliver Great Outcomes.

About The Role

The Business Data Analyst at Auctane will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization. This position focuses on uncovering insights that inform business development, customer experience, and go-to-market initiatives. Working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Strategy teams, the candidate will develop robust reporting, identify growth opportunities, and support data-informed decision-making across the organization. The role will contribute to scaling Auctane's analytics capabilities and enhance the overall data ecosystem through collaboration and the delivery of high-impact solutions.

About The Team

The Analytics team supports key business decision making through the delivery of actionable insights based on accurate data to stakeholders across the Auctane e-commerce products. These responsibilities are delivered through close collaboration with internal teams, working on the definition & refinement of the KPIs, setting goals against these KPIs, measuring performance against these goals and recommending (and when applicable, implementing) actions to drive improved performance. In addition, the Analytics team leads the delivery of both standardized & ad-hoc reporting, analysis & insights to drive business decisions.

What will you be doing?


Collaborate with engineering and business stakeholders to translate business needs into scalable, data-driven solutions while ensuring alignment and effective communication.
Generate actionable insights to support both strategic initiatives and day-to-day operational execution.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable reporting systems and dashboards, including tactical, strategic, and executive-level views that inform decision-making across Auctane brands.
Develop and maintain KPI reporting for core business areas such as Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success.
Define, implement, and manage key data feeds from internal systems and external partners to support accurate business performance measurement.
Work with large, complex datasets, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and consistency across the pipeline.
Participate in and lead analytic projects from problem definition through analysis to the clear presentation of results.
Promote adoption of analytics tools and reporting standards by delivering impactful reports, providing team training, and championing best practices.
Demonstrate a strategic mindset, simplifying complexity through innovative and scalable analytics solutions that address evolving business needs.


What are we looking for?


Four or more (4+) years experience in data-driven environments with an expert knowledge of SQL and translating complex datasets into clear business insights.
Experience designing and creating dashboards for use by Executives and Analysts.
Strong eye for detail and a passion for quickly delivering results for rapid action.
Comfortable working in a highly collaborative, consensus-oriented environment.
Excellent written, verbal, scientific communication and time management skills.
Data visualization and storytelling: ability to turn complex data into clear insights.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience, as well as the ability to design and deploy clear reporting assets.
Ability to work cross functionally to collaboratively understand and deliver on business needs.
English fluency is required


What will make you stand out?


Strong track record of learning new tools, technologies, and frameworks.
Experience with version control tools such as GitHub for collaborative analytics development.


The tech stack


Looker (incl. LookML): advanced proficiency in developing dashboards, explores, and custom views.
SQL (BigQuery): strong proficiency in querying large-scale databases.
DBT (Cloud): experience building and maintaining data models and transformations.
Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.


What do we offer?


üí∏ Clear and transparent compensation plan. Salary range: 47000 ‚Ç¨ to 59000‚Ç¨/year. We will discuss the indicated range with you in the first recruiting call to ensure that we are on the same page.
üóìÔ∏è Annual Salary Review: We are reviewing the salaries of all our teams annually in order to evaluate an increase according to individual performance and the business results.

üíô Up to 150 ‚Ç¨/year to match your NGO donations! We are happy to support your initiatives by duplicating the amount donated.

Referral Fee üîó We need your support in hiring top-class talent! We offer a referral bonus of 1k-3K, depending on the complexity of the role and the hiring process.

üíú An inclusive and upbeat work environment Leave your suit behind... we're a t-shirt and converse kind of place! More importantly, our company culture promotes diversity and inclusion. The personality and opinions of each of our team members are important and valid, and we aim to offer all employees a safe environment where they can be themselves and thrive.

üì∫ Internal and external training, free access to online training platforms such as Linkedin Learning
üè† We are a remote-first company All team members at Auctane Spain are remote employees. You can decide if you want to work in the office 2 days a week or 3 days per quarter‚Äîit's up to you. We also cover your expenses for working from home (50‚Ç¨ net per month/600‚Ç¨ per year).
üåÖ We have 25 days of holidays per year (23+üéÇ your Birthday Take your birthday off to celebrate!+Christmas+New Year's Eve).

üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è 10 hours per year to support your family members when going to the doctor)

We want to help you improve your technical skills, feel involved in the product community, and develop your soft skills to lead teams and manage other stakeholders.
üí∞ Flexible Salary We work with a flexible compensation plan for transport, restaurants, and kindergarten so our employees can save on personal income tax via Cobee.

Up to 42‚Ç¨ to cover your Gym membership or exercise classes (pilates, kick-boxing, etc.).
We provide private health insurance, we offer a great plan courtesy of our partner Cigna.

Title: Analyst, Analytics & Insights Delivery
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



The Global Business Optimisation team has a simple mission: we turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value. Our analytic consultants and data analysts work with Visa‚Äôs clients, partners, and staff to improve portfolio performance, program profitability, and cardholder experiences. By coupling in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa‚Äôs world-class products, digital offerings, and marketing capabilities, we ensure our clients‚Äô programs operate at their peak potential and that cardholders have seamless commerce experiences in both the physical and digital world.



As part of the Client Services organisation, this role will take ownership of this vision and deliver with excellence for our organisation and our clients. The successful candidate will use strong big data and analytical skills, contextual business sense, and a creative flair to solve real-world business challenges for Visa issuing banks, acquirers, merchants, and processors. In addition, your analytic expertise will directly impact the strategic direction of the organisation and how we deliver value from our data assets.



The successful candidate will be a key member in Global Business Optimisation, within Client Services, supporting all aspects of improving and optimising payment success, including but not exclusive to authentication and authorisation. Responsible for building and deploying a single source of truth on insights, facts, and reporting related to the Visa Europe Regions payment processing.



Responsibilities



Assist other team members in deriving analytic insights on client performance and deliver findings to external and internal stakeholders, by proactively advising on how to improve performance.
Formulate and source necessary datasets from internal tools and platforms, rendering insights in compelling presentations and visualizations.
Create and present analytic deliverables to external Visa clients, colleagues in the analytics team, and other internal stakeholders with varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise.
Develop specific knowledge on authentication and/or authorisation, with active monitoring and client meetings to help them improve and optimise performance.
Identify and understand the root cause of problems, define analytical objectives, and formalise data requirements for various types of analyses.
Combine and analyse disparate data sources and derive insights in a Big Data environment.
Work with a pan-European team located in multiple locations and contribute to global projects.
Proactively facilitate the overall analytic delivery strategy for the organisation.
Compare client performance against industry best practices to identify performance and/or profitability improvement opportunities.
Present complex data and content to clients in an accurate, understandable, and engaging manner, considering stakeholders' varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise by translating analysis and insights into stakeholder & client language.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.









Qualifications



Basic Qualifications

2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)



Preferred Qualifications

3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)

2+ years of working experience in a corporate environment.

Visa experience or knowledge of the payments industry is highly preferable.

Knowledge of the Authorisation/ Authentication process is highly preferable.

Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills required.

Proven client presentation skills.

Proactive, curious, problem solver with experience of being a self-starter and a willingness to learn.

Experience working in data analysis and/or insight delivery with a proven record of creating business value from data.

Basic level of manipulating data from a variety of sources - Big data skills (Hadoop, Hive, Spark) and/or SQL skills is an advantage.

Experience visualizing data with tools such as Tableau or Power BI.

Must be proficient in all MS Office applications with advanced Excel spreadsheet skills.

Excellent spoken and written command of English.

Knowledge of additional European language(s) is an advantage.





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Associate Performance Analyst
Description:
Job description:



We are Lightsource bp ‚Äì and we‚Äôre on a mission to become a global leader in onshore renewables, anchored by our proven track record in solar development.¬†

¬†

For over a decade we‚Äôve been actively working to diversify the way our world is powered with sustainable and responsible renewable power. We work to safely deliver affordable, reliable, large-scale onshore renewable and energy storage solutions to help the world decarbonise.¬†

¬†

Our growing business is constantly innovating and investing to help drive the energy transition. Our people and projects are focused on supporting long-term sustainable growth and energy security.¬†

¬†

Lightsource bp (LSbp) was fully acquired by bp in 2024.¬†

¬†

Global Performance & Monitoring

¬†

The LSbp Global Performance & Monitoring team sits within the Engineering business, acting as the nerve centre through which all asset data flows on a daily basis. The insights generated by the team are disseminated across Lightsource, providing the foundation for data-based decision-making. From a simple decision to dispatch an engineer to site to investigate a fault to deciding to proceed with a multi-million-pound site retrofit, the process starts with the Global Performance & Monitoring team. We measure our success by the performance of our international fleet of assets, as well as by the service we provide to our O&M and Asset Management colleagues, in the form of data feeds, reporting, insight generation, and recommendations.

¬†

The team is seeking to expand, adding an Associate Performance Analyst who will broaden the team‚Äôs ability to manage our team‚Äôs portfolio of assets under management, currently 5.0 GW of solar and battery storage across six countries. The successful candidate will join an existing team of 8 in Madrid, as well as an additional 11 UK-based colleagues.¬†

¬†

Role Summary

The role will be focused on asset performance analysis and the calculation and reporting of key performance indicators (availability, performance ratios, events monitoring, etc.). The main parts of the role will involve daily monitoring of the health of the power plants, data quality assurance, analysis of energy and irradiance metering, and other performance analysis in Excel, Power BI, and/or other data analysis tools. The role also includes reporting business intelligence, and data visualisation responsibilities.

¬†

The successful candidate will help create reports to be used internally for decision-making, as well as those delivered externally to asset owners, financial lenders, and tax equity partners. Advanced analytical skills are required for success in this role.

¬†

Duties and Responsibilities¬†

¬†

Regular health monitoring of the plants through our Monitoring System, analysing system-generated alarms with the aim to identify technical issues and potential underperformance
Calculation of KPIs and other performance metrics for the sites for which you are responsible (e.g., Availability, Performance Ratio, etc.)
Data analysis to investigate the root cause and quantify the impact on performance of identified issues
Engagement with Asset Managers and the rest of the Global Performance & Monitoring Team to track known issues through to resolution
Generation of regular reports on the performance of the sites which detail performance via the main KPIs and explain underperformance via known technical issues / underperformance events
Support continuous improvement efforts via the development of new tools for streamlining our data analysis and reporting automation (i.e., scripts to automate manual calculations, improve data manipulation or automate reporting / dashboards)
Support on the implementation and testing of the company‚Äôs new, industry-leading Data Lake and System of Insight (KPI Management, Reporting and Analytics tool).

¬†

Work Skills

¬†

Must be fluent in spoken and written English
Must be an advanced user of Microsoft Excel
Must be able to work with large datasets and be comfortable querying datasets
Python, R, SQL and/or other programming skills are strongly desired
Automated data visualisation & communication experience (e.g., Power BI) will be considered an asset

¬†

General Skills/Attributes¬†

¬†

Possesses an analytical mind, keen to identify and solve problems
Excellent written and verbal communications skills ‚Äì able to go beyond just presenting data to pull out key insights
Able to manage interaction with internal and external stakeholders
Relentless attention to detail and drive to produce quality work
Organisation and work ethic to deliver against critical deadlines
Possesses a mindset of continuous improvement, always looking for opportunities to improve, both as an individual and a team
Is a team player but also able to work independently
Passionate about renewables and the energy transition

¬†

Knowledge¬†

¬†

Direct knowledge of solar energy generation is not absolutely necessary; however, a candidate will be well-served by a basic understanding of:

Basic principles of electricity generation
Key photovoltaic (PV) plant components and methods of operation
PV plant performance parameters such as PR, availability, etc.
Basic data flows underlying SCADA and monitoring systems

¬†

Experience Required

¬†

Must have demonstrable experience of data analysis / generating and communicating insights from quantitative information
Ideal candidate would have previous exposure to utility-scale renewable plants
Ideal candidate would have prior experience working with monitoring and SCADA systems

¬†

Education and Qualifications¬†

Degree in Renewable Energy, Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, or Computer Science; or, Foundation Degree (eg, FdA, FdSc), Diploma of Higher Education (DipHE) related with Renewable Energy or/and data analysis.

¬†

Why you‚Äôll want to work for us

¬†

Our company is a place where you can be yourself and grow; a place where your ideas and opinions matter.

¬†

Be you

We pride ourselves on being an inclusive community, where every individual is valued and treated with respect.¬†

¬†

Be responsible

Our culture is driven by our core values. From operating safely to ensuring our Renewable Energy projects are responsible and promote biodiversity.¬†

¬†

Be recognized

Alongside a competitive salary, we offer a variety of benefits including annual bonus, retention bank, health insurance, pension and other local benefits.¬†

¬†

Be inspired

Beyond your day-to-day working life at Lightsource bp, there‚Äôs a variety of initiatives that will contribute to your own personal development. Initiatives to get involved with including our charitable causes, supporting our solar honey project or our sustainability initiatives.¬†

¬†

Our Core Values

Lightsource bp truly cares about creating a sustainable future through safe, responsible and meaningful low carbon energy projects. Our core values of Safety, Integrity, Respect, Sustainability and Drive are the guiding principles for everything we do.

¬†

https://www.lightsourcebp.com/careers/

¬†
