You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners‚Äô experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one.

THE JOURNEY

  • Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
  • Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
  • Ensure data pipelines and development processes are operationalprocesses operational and efficient.
  • Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
  • Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo‚Äôs partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
  • Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
  • Execute end-to-end projects at a global level

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
  • Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
  • Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
  • Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
  • Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
  • Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
  • Great team player and organizational skills
  • Experience in managing projects is a plus
  • International studies or experience is a plus

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile game studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games consistently rank among the top on iOS and Android, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, our mission is simple: to create amazing gaming experiences and bring fun to everyone!

We‚Äôre looking for a Game Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. In this role, you'll analyze player behavior, collaborate with game teams, and help improve our games by driving retention and user conversion.

Using quantitative analysis, data science, statistics, and programming, you‚Äôll generate insights that make a real impact at Socialpoint. To succeed, you‚Äôll need to learn quickly, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and work closely with both analytics and game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working model from home and office. What does this mean? You need to live within commuting distance of our Barcelona office to attend important meetings and events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona, if you're not already here.
An impressive 25 days of annual leave, not including public holidays.
An additional 5 days of annual leave during Christmas.
Full Catering for Breakfast and lunch at the office
Private medical insurance for you and your family to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest iOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons in English and Spanish.
Spotify Premium to add a special soundtrack to your adventure.
Legendary social events and parties to let off some steam.
Personal development is key for us: enjoy a significant budget to enhance your skills and knowledge, providing real growth opportunities!


What We Offer You:

Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Gym Facilities: Want to stay in shape? We have state-of-the-art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
New Office: Enjoy our brand-new office, complete with top-tier amenities, including a professional barista and delicious breakfast options.
Onsite Physiotherapist: Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for any aches and pains.
Onsite Hairdressers: Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on and apply now! Click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Diversity & Conclusion Statement

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment with us is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic ‚Äì not an individual‚Äôs race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at recruitment@socialpoint.es to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Socialpoint does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Socialpoint also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Socialpoint‚Äôs in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
BI Data Analyst - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced BI Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona. Our Business Intelligence team is the centre of excellence for providing insights and learning from the Data. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

Millions of customers every year across 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 7M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 6 billion daily AI predictions[e1]

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents ‚Äì 99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Data Analyst in the BI team, you will be in charge of:


Analyse performance and identify behaviours in different data sets; Translate complex and potentially ambiguous information into a clear structure and actionable deliverables.
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality;
Build and maintain dashboards and/or reports to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;
Identify and analyze relevant customer data to drive business goals and validate hypothesis & designs; turn data into actionable insights;
Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge
Working with multi-disciplinary teams ‚Äì Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers ‚Äì to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets.



What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or other quantitative fields);
Minimum 3 years of experience as an analyst in a digital and eCommerce environment.
Strong knowledge of tools and programming languages such as BigQuery/SQL, Python, R;
Experience with cloud platforms and scalable solutions will be a plus.
Self-starter with good time management skills; able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize quickly the most relevant ones;
Ability to multitask; desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced, high-performance environment;
Written and oral communication skills (in English).



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO! If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

  • Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.


Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO! If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Data Analyst Junior - Transportation Analyst, Central Operations Services
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, Relo, LCS, Kariba, Tyres, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in inbound (IB) and outbound (OB) process paths.

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end 24/7 support in 3PL buildings across European External Fulfilment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management. The successful candidate will be responsible for group of tasks involving KPI monitoring, solving system issues and analyzing process standards execution. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support on 24/7 shift patter for 30+ buildings in Europe.

As EU 3PL Control Tower Specialist you will support Outbound 3PL operations, drive the continuous improvement and process standardization and optimization. You will conduct weekly process analysis that will drive to process waste reduction.

Please note that this is a day shift role, working from 6 am to 14 pm.

Key job responsibilities


Monitoring and analyzing sites hourly performance
Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Resolving system discrepancies
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Supporting with AFTx launches and migration with SME expertise, implementing required tasks for further operational support
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- B2/C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon Spain Fulfillment, S.L.U.

Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, Relo, LCS, Kariba, Tyres, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in inbound (IB) and outbound (OB) process paths.

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end 24/7 support in 3PL buildings across European External Fulfilment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management. The successful candidate will be responsible for group of tasks involving KPI monitoring, solving system issues and analyzing process standards execution. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support on 24/7 shift patter for 30+ buildings in Europe.

As EU 3PL Control Tower Specialist you will support Outbound 3PL operations, drive the continuous improvement and process standardization and optimization. You will conduct weekly process analysis that will drive to process waste reduction.

Please note that this is a day shift role, working from 6 am to 14 pm.

Key job responsibilities

  • Monitoring and analyzing sites hourly performance
  • Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
  • Resolving system discrepancies
  • Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
  • Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
  • Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
  • Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
  • Supporting with AFTx launches and migration with SME expertise, implementing required tasks for further operational support
  • Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.

Basic Qualifications

  • - Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • - B2/C1 English level
  • - Spanish C2 level

Preferred Qualifications

  • High school or equivalent diploma
  • Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, AI, etc.
  • Experience in logistics.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing the performance of various campaigns, A/B tests, etc.. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will collaborate also with the Data team, which consists of data science and data engineering, to continuously enhance your data platform and reporting tools.

This role requires good knowledge of measurement techniques, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies.

What You Will Do



Support marketing team members in making data-driven decisions by analysing and interpreting marketing data, especially A/B test results and incremental tests used to measure our campaign efforts.
Build and maintain dashboards in Metabase, providing marketing teams with clear and actionable insights to optimise campaigns and track performance.
Apply tools and techniques for marketing data analysis and visualisation to measure and improve marketing performance.
Represent and summarise marketing data and insights in clear, actionable reports.
Research new marketing use cases for existing data, and suggest new data sources to incorporate for better analysis.
Share insights, findings, and best practices for marketing analytics with analysts across other business units.
Help shape marketing strategies by providing data-backed recommendations to optimise campaigns and boost ROI.
Develop training programs and enablement sessions to improve data literacy within the marketing team.
Advocate for measurement solutions that align with Proton‚Äôs privacy-first mission, ensuring user trust and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. Develop training and enablement programs to increase data literacy



Job Requirements



Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with a focus on marketing metrics.
Experience in business intelligence, marketing KPIs & web analytics.
At least 5 years of relevant working experience in marketing data analysis - it is a must.
Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing marketing data.
Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with A/B testing and incremental testing methodologies, and experience with reporting and analysing test results.



Bonus points for:



Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
Experience in a global, fast-paced, high-growth company environment.



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more
HTML:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing the performance of various campaigns, A/B tests, etc.. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will collaborate also with the Data team, which consists of data science and data engineering, to continuously enhance your data platform and reporting tools.

This role requires good knowledge of measurement techniques, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies.

What You Will Do


  • Support marketing team members in making data-driven decisions by analysing and interpreting marketing data, especially A/B test results and incremental tests used to measure our campaign efforts.
  • Build and maintain dashboards in Metabase, providing marketing teams with clear and actionable insights to optimise campaigns and track performance.
  • Apply tools and techniques for marketing data analysis and visualisation to measure and improve marketing performance.
  • Represent and summarise marketing data and insights in clear, actionable reports.
  • Research new marketing use cases for existing data, and suggest new data sources to incorporate for better analysis.
  • Share insights, findings, and best practices for marketing analytics with analysts across other business units.
  • Help shape marketing strategies by providing data-backed recommendations to optimise campaigns and boost ROI.
  • Develop training programs and enablement sessions to improve data literacy within the marketing team.
  • Advocate for measurement solutions that align with Proton‚Äôs privacy-first mission, ensuring user trust and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. Develop training and enablement programs to increase data literacy


Job Requirements


  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
  • Strong analytical skills with a focus on marketing metrics.
  • Experience in business intelligence, marketing KPIs & web analytics.
  • At least 5 years of relevant working experience in marketing data analysis - it is a must.
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing marketing data.
  • Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar platforms.
  • Familiarity with A/B testing and incremental testing methodologies, and experience with reporting and analysing test results.


Bonus points for:


  • Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
  • Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
  • Experience in a global, fast-paced, high-growth company environment.


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Data Analyst (M/F)
Description:
You want to join a company that places people at the heart of its concerns? We are waiting for you at Extia!

Extia is an engineering consultancy which proposes since 2007 an unprecedented approach in its sector by combining well-being and performance at work. A successful model: more than 3000 Extians working in 22 agencies in France and abroad, 1st Great Place To Work¬Æ in France, 160 millions of euros of turnover and plenty of energy!

At Extia, it's "First who, then what" so, let's do it!

First who

Involved, always willing to help your team.

Teamwork: Able to work in a multicultural environment.

Proactive, you enjoy projects that move forward quickly and efficiently.

Organized

Then what

Main Responsibilities in the Role



Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and generate reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printed materials, and performance indicators to identify and correct coding issues.
Identify and define new opportunities for process improvement.



Education and Experience



Studies in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering.
Minimum of 1 to 2 years of experience in a similar role.
Knowledge of PHP and/or Python programming languages.
Experience with Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of SQL.



What We Offer at Extia



Personalized career development plan.
Meal vouchers.
Private health insurance.
Public transportation reimbursement.
International and young work environment.
Office just a few meters from the beach.
Free drinks (beer, coffee, water, tea, milk).
Hybrid work mode (3 days remote, 2 days in-office).
Events (training sessions, meetups, after-work gatherings, parties).



Whatever you can think of, we welcome it! üöÄ

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

‚Ä¢ Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

‚Ä¢Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

‚Ä¢Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

‚Ä¢Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

‚Ä¢Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

‚Ä¢ SQL advanced

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

‚Ä¢ Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

‚Ä¢ Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

‚Ä¢ AWS

‚Ä¢ Microsoft Azure cloud computing

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with DataOps principles

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Agile methodologies

‚Ä¢ Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

‚Ä¢ You have good presentation skills.

‚Ä¢ You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

‚Ä¢ You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst (MedTech Insights)
Description:
We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Medtech group in Barcelona.

In this role, you will build MedTech therapy expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global MedTech customers. You will also actively develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

If you have passion for the dynamic MedTech landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


PhD in relevant subject area (science or business)
2-5 years of industry experience relating to quantitative data analysis
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions
Excellent read and written Spanish (Native or C2) and excellent read, spoken and written English (Native or C1/C2)


It would be great if you also had . . .


Experience in building market forecast models and converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models
Relevant experience in the medical device, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors
Experience using SQL
You know how to deliver an effective presentation
Passionate about data and insights‚Äîyou have the intrinsic drive to push boundaries on how we leverage data.
You appreciate the freedom to make an impact that you can own.
You are solution-oriented‚Äîyou value ideas but understand the importance of execution.
Thrive in a rapidly changing business.
Respect deadlines and able to handle multiple projects at once.


What will you be doing in this role?


Author comprehensive market research reports that provide quantitative and qualitative insights on specific medical device markets around the world.
Build market models by leveraging Clarivate‚Äôs proprietary healthcare datasets, while incorporating public financial, regulatory, and government data.
Interview industry stakeholders and medical professionals to contextualize data and form insights.
Understand the worldview and pain points of Clarivate clients, working closely with them as a problem-solver. From Fortune 500 companies to smaller startups, you will converse with high-profile clients regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusions to them.
Engage in cross-functional collaboration on initiatives and projects impacting multiple teams.
Contribute your vision; influence the evolution of our products, data models, and data usage strategy.


About The Team

Clarivate's Medtech Insights team harnesses real-world healthcare data, in-depth interviews, and our unique mix of in-house expertise to help medical device companies make some of their most important business decisions.

The Medtech Insights team, with members located in Canada, India, and Spain, is an essential part of the broader Medtech team's data-driven culture, and regularly contributes its subject matter expertise to other teams within the organization.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Data Analyst, Solutions and Innovation
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our AXSI team, you'll be at the forefront of measurement and experimentation. Your role will be crucial in helping our clients understand and maximise their return on investment while driving innovation in the rapidly evolving digital advertising landscape.


Incrementality measurement: Enable advertisers to quantify and understand the true value of Criteo's solutions through sophisticated measurement methodologies
Client Consultations: Partner with advertisers to deeply understand their business objectives and define meaningful success metrics for their advertising investments
Experimentation Design: Craft and implement robust testing strategies tailored to each client's unique needs and business context
Analysis & Communication: Transform complex experimental data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for clients
Measurement Innovation: Contribute to our suite of measurement tools, enabling teams across Criteo to evaluate and optimise their initiatives
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges
Solid foundation in statistical inference methodologies and experience in designing and analysing A/B tests
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies
Ability to synthesise complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Junior Data Practitioner - hybrid Barcelona/Madrid
Description:
Mission

Aily Labs is rewriting how businesses make decisions. Founded in 2020, we‚Äôre a fast-growing applied AI scaleup operating across Munich, Madrid, Barcelona, New York, and Cluj-Napoca. Our AI-powered mobile app delivers real-time, actionable business insights, empowering enterprises to make smarter, faster decisions and break silos at scale.

We focus on high-impact AI technology -no fluff, no filler - giving users accurate real time decision intelligence.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Since 1890, all around the globe, employees in Allianz have been working hard to secure people‚Äôs lives and to give courage to our customers for what‚Äôs ahead. We are actuaries, advisors and service agents; engineers, lawyers and technology experts; we are daughters and sons, mothers and fathers, accountants, investors and entrepreneurs ‚Äì and together we are shaping our industry.

Because we know how important it is to have a fair partner at your side who provides solid and sustainable solutions, we strive to do it right ‚Äì with passion, every day. Allianz Technology enables Allianz Group to live up to its purpose, by providing powerful, standardized global platforms to provide efficiencies, savings and scalability for the long-term success of Allianz.

About The Job

As a key member of the People Analytics team, you will leverage your expertise in Data Analytics to drive automation and develop innovative data products that empower Allianz Technology teams globally. Collaborating closely with colleagues in Germany, Romania, and India, you will ensure high-quality data is readily available to support autonomous, data-driven decision-making across Allianz Technology.

Your role involves compiling and consolidating diverse data sets to deliver actionable insights to the People Leadership teams and the broader business. You will engage with global and local business stakeholders to define requirements for data definitions and analytics, ensuring alignment with Allianz Technology's strategic priorities.

Your focus will be on enhancing the efficiency of the global reporting landscape through automation, enabling teams to independently access and utilize People analytics data. Additionally, you will contribute your analytical expertise to Allianz Group initiatives and projects, collaborating with Allianz Technology People function Product Owners, Business Partners, IT functions, service providers, and the Allianz Group‚Äôs global People & Culture function to drive data innovation and autonomy.

What You Do


Partner with various entities, People & Culture Leadership, and business leaders to define critical People & Culture data needs and drive a data-driven culture for strategic decision-making.
Define and standardize key People metrics, KPIs, and benchmarks to measure workforce effectiveness, transforming these into robust data products and developing AI-driven analytics solutions for enhanced decision-making.
Collaborate with IT and HRIS teams to optimize People data infrastructure, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance with regulations like GDPR and CCPA, while driving automation and self-service analytics capabilities.
Design advanced People Analytics solutions to predict turnover, enhance employee engagement, and drive DEI strategies, utilizing NLP and sentiment analysis for employee feedback and local compensation analytics for pay equity.
Provide expert guidance to People Data Analysts to enhance skills, facilitate collaboration between People & Culture, IT, Finance, and business units, and share best practices for reporting and insights communication.
Advocate for the development and utilization of data products to streamline processes, enhance data-driven decision-making, and ensure alignment on organizational streamlining activities and data initiatives.
Be an active member of the global Analytics team, taking ownership of topics and being a thought leader to elevate the team's proficiency and impact.


What You Bring


7+ years of experience in People analytics, workforce planning, or related fields, preferably in an international environment, with proficiency in data analytics languages such as SQL and Python.
Expert user of leading data visualization tools, ideally Power BI, with experience in data modeling and exposure to predictive modeling, machine learning, and AI-driven analytics.
Strong understanding of People metrics, compensation analytics, and talent management KPIs, with a proven track record in fostering a data-driven culture.
Strong communication skills to translate complex data into actionable business insights and engage effectively with stakeholders in virtual teams across various continents and cultures.
Ability to work independently, demonstrating good self-organization, prioritization, and time management skills while maintaining quality levels in reporting and meeting deadlines.
Good assertiveness, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with a customer-service-oriented, hands-on mentality and high attention to detail.
Fluent in both spoken and written English, with methodological and conceptual skills, and analytical thinking; other languages are an advantage.


What We Offer


We offer a hybrid work model which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working incl. up to 25 days per year working from abroad.
We believe in rewarding performance and our compensation and benefits package includes a company bonus scheme, pension, employee shares program and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).
From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
Flexible working, health and wellbeing offers (including healthcare and parental leave benefits) support to balance family and career and help our people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach.


About Allianz Technology

With its headquarters in Munich, Germany, Allianz Technology is Allianz's global IT service provider and delivers IT solutions that drive the group's digitalization. With more than 11,000 employees in over 20 countries around the world, Allianz Technology is tasked to run, optimize, transform, and innovate the infrastructure, applications, and services together with Allianz companies to co-create the best customer experience.

We service the entire spectrum of digitalization ‚Äì from one of the industry's largest IT infrastructure projects that spans data centres, networks, and security, to application platforms ranging from workplace services to digital interaction.

In short: We deliver comprehensive end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age. We are the backbone of Allianz.

Find us at: www.linkedin.com/company/allianz-technology .

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and commits itself to creating an inclusive work environment for all.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT.

To Recruitment Agencies:

Allianz Technology has an in-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Technology does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies or search firm recruiters.

When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place. Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About FESTO: FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales processes and strategies.




Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data analysis, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to turn data into actionable insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead the collection, cleaning, and analysis of large and complex data sets to support business operations (sales, web analytics, marketing‚Ä¶).
Develop and maintain advanced reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and drive business insights.
Develop and present comprehensive data-driven insights and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
Mentor and guide junior data analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
Review and oversee tasks performed by junior analysts, ensuring accuracy and quality of work.
Conceptualize, follow up, and deliver analytics projects, including definition of KPIs, creation and communication of insights, and project definitions for junior analysts.




Qualifications:

Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a sales or business analytics role.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and technical leadership
Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale cloud data analysis frameworks
Proficiency in Python and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Ability to extract and translate business metrics and questions from data sets into well-documented and actionable insights.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data-driven insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.




Not sure if this exact role is the perfect match for your profile?

No problem! We‚Äôre currently growing out our data and AI teams and looking at a variety of profiles. If you‚Äôre interested in working with us and feel your skills could be a good fit, we encourage you to apply anyway!

Title: People Data Analytics Intern
Description:
ü™ê Discover our galaxy

Join the Future of Work ! Malt is Europe's leading freelance marketplace, connecting over 700,000 talented freelancers with 70,000+ companies. Founded in 2013, we're transforming how work gets done through our tech-powered, human-centered platform. What makes us different:


A diverse team of 600 Malters across 6 European countries
A culture that champions equality (50% of our Comex are women) and inclusive growth
Backed by top investors including ISAI, Serena Capital, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs, and BPI
A mission to give everyone the freedom to work differently




Ready to help shape the future of work? Your next chapter starts here! ü™ê

At Malt we believe that Ambition is the Way, so all lists of missions and responsibilities are non-exhaustive.

About the role:

Do you have a passion for data? If so, then this People Data Analyst Internship is the perfect opportunity for you! As our People Data Analytics Intern, you will actively contribute by analyzing and leveraging people data to drive impact. In this internship, you will gain valuable experience in all aspects of the data analysis lifecycle, from data acquisition and cleaning to advanced analysis and impactful visualization.

Key Responsibilities ‚ú®

Data Management & Preparation


Assist with the collection, extraction, and transformation of people data from various HR systems and sources, including but not limited to HR tools (e.g., Lever, BambooHR)
Prepare and clean data for analysis, ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and completeness through data validation and quality checks
Maintain and update data documentation and processes




Data Analysis & Insights Generation:


Support the analysis of people data to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to key HR metrics such as recruitment, retention, engagement, performance, and learning & development
Assist in the creation of ad-hoc reports and survey analyses to support HR initiatives and business needs




Dashboard Development & Reporting:


Develop, maintain, and enhance People dashboards using visualization tools to effectively communicate key insights and metrics to various stakeholders across the organization




Project Support, Collaboration, and Continuous Learning:


Support the development and implementation of people analytics/HRIS projects
Collaborate effectively with members of the People team to understand their specific data needs and provide relevant, insightful findings
Stay up-to-date on the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in the fields of people analytics and data visualization
Provide support to the team on HRIS topics as needed




About You üßë‚ÄçüöÄ


Currently enrolled in a Master's degree program in Statistics, Data/Business Analytics, Human Resources with a strong analytical focus, or a related quantitative field
Strong data analysis skills with Excel/Google Sheets - experience in data manipulation, formulas, and charting
Great collaboration and teamwork skills
Curious mindset with attention to detail
Fluent English and operational French and ready to collaborate with various stakeholders both International and French




Our Recruitment process


First call with Annabelle, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (30 minutes)
Interview with your future manager Sandrine, to discuss your experience and the role in more detail (45-60 minutes)
Your profile is validated, and will welcome you in our Parisian office September 2025 !




Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally üí´


Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you‚Äôll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
Paid vacation - 1 paid day/month worked for interns, 5 weeks/year for apprenticeships
Lunch vouchers: ‚Ç¨9/day on your Swile card
Transportation: 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
Free books: If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt‚Äôs business, just tell us the books you‚Äôd like to read, and we‚Äôll order them for you‚Äîwithout any questions asked or approval processes to follow
Remote work: Hybrid remote policy
Annual team building events

We recruit based on skills, experience, and potential, without any form of discrimination related to age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, or disability. Our mission is to create a work environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and safe to thrive.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Global Master Data Analyst

Global Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of code creation process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Material Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Marketing/Initiative Leader. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty‚Äôs growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering ‚ÄúData Readiness‚Äù during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:


Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
Understanding of the product creation cycles and basic data, whilst understanding the business impacts.
Identify systemic errors and trend analysis, being able to root cause, sharing a clear issue statement.
Tracking all new project status, with direct contact and communication across different workstreams, to guarantee the visibility and status of data readiness in SAP for all new initiative in the scope, giving priority based on business requirements.
Follow up with departments involved with Master Data functionality reporting clear issue statement, tackling business needs with clarity and structure.


Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of five Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Marketing, Planning, R&D, Quality and IT. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business‚Äôs need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
Team Player mindset.
Strong sense of individual accountability ‚Äì personal drive to improve and passionate ownership of performance.
Autonomous motivation to implement changes and challenge the current process / system to deliver improved results.
Good English level and communication skills.


Our Benefits

As our Master Data Analyst some of the benefits you will receive are:


A salary that matches your knowledge and experience
Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.
Flexible working hours
Meal voucher
Medical & Physiotherapy Service


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A telephone/online introductory meeting.
A first online/in-person interview
A second interview
You will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed.
