Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬øTienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podr√≠as asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estar√°s en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de qui√©n seas o cu√°l sea tu funci√≥n, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misi√≥n: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor dise√±ado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el √©xito de los dem√°s. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una direcci√≥n nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente est√©s pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Adem√°s de grandes compa√±eros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonom√≠a y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitir√° alcanzar el √©xito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliaci√≥n y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una pol√≠tica que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 d√≠as al a√±o. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

üèÅ La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos r√°pido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de ense√±anza y aprendizaje. Y tendr√°s sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

üåà Nuestra f√≥rmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Te incorporar√°s como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que est√°n afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempe√±o y resultados en ventas y en retenci√≥n de p√≥lizas.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online


Analizar los factores que impactan la conversi√≥n del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra p√°gina web por los diferentes canales, apoy√°ndote en el an√°lisis detallado de datos y en herramientas de an√°lisis web e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compa√±√≠a.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversi√≥n online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversi√≥n.


Eficiencia operativa


Analizar oportunidades para mejorar la eficiencia del equipo de Atenci√≥n al Cliente, dando soporte al Team Leader, a partir de los datos de las interacciones con clientes.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a mejorar los resultados y la contribuci√≥n de los agentes.
Crear dashboards de monitoreo y an√°lisis de desempe√±o con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.


Otras √°reas


Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compa√±√≠a para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores pr√°cticas.
Dar soporte a la Head of Online Sales & Marketing en iniciativas y proyectos estrat√©gicos, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales online, o la definici√≥n de modelos de atribuci√≥n.


¬øQu√© buscamos?

Ser√≠as ideal para el equipo si cumples estos requisitos:


Al menos 3 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos.
Buena experiencia en la creaci√≥n de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulaci√≥n y extracci√≥n de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
Buenas habilidades de visi√≥n de negocio.
Habilidades anal√≠ticas y experiencia en la creaci√≥n de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
Grado universitario en campos afines al an√°lisis de datos (Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Ingenier√≠a, Inform√°tica, ADE o Econom√≠a).
Nivel de ingl√©s medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.


Ser√≠a fant√°stico si...

Adem√°s de los requisitos b√°sicos, evaluaremos con atenci√≥n las siguientes caracter√≠sticas:


Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
Buenas habilidades interpersonales y de negociaci√≥n, resoluci√≥n de problemas, determinaci√≥n.
Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
Iniciativa y proactividad.
Experiencia con otras diferentes herramientas tecnol√≥gicas.


Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambici√≥n. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusi√≥n en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminaci√≥n por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religi√≥n, orientaci√≥n sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, informaci√≥n gen√©tica, embarazo u otras caracter√≠sticas personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislaci√≥n nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, √∫nete a nosotros en el fast lane.

Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitir√° alcanzar el √©xito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliaci√≥n y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una pol√≠tica que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 d√≠as al a√±o. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

üèÅ La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos r√°pido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de ense√±anza y aprendizaje. Y tendr√°s sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

üåà Nuestra f√≥rmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Te incorporar√°s como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que est√°n afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempe√±o y resultados en ventas y en retenci√≥n de p√≥lizas.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online

  • Analizar los factores que impactan la conversi√≥n del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra p√°gina web por los diferentes canales, apoy√°ndote en el an√°lisis detallado de datos y en herramientas de an√°lisis web e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
  • Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
  • Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compa√±√≠a.
  • Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversi√≥n online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
  • Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversi√≥n.

  • Crear dashboards de monitoreo y an√°lisis de desempe√±o con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.

Otras √°reas

  • Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compa√±√≠a para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores pr√°cticas.

  • Nivel de ingl√©s medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.

Adem√°s de los requisitos b√°sicos, evaluaremos con atenci√≥n las siguientes caracter√≠sticas:

Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambici√≥n. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusi√≥n en el lugar de trabajo. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.




If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.




We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data analyst you will:




Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




For us, a Data analyst is someone who:




Knows about:




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes




Can:




Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.




Loves to:




Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.




Defines himself/herself as a:




A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues‚Äô needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RI√ëG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Are you passionate about transforming raw data into powerful insights? As a Data Analyst, you'll navigate through complex data ecosystems from sources like SalesForce Sales & Service and ERP systems, seamlessly integrating them to create a unified data landscape. You'll spearhead the development of scalable data processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate cutting-edge analytics tools, and craft insightful dashboards and reports that drive strategic business decisions.

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with a minimum of 5 years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Business Intelligence (BI) development within a Microsoft SQL environment.

Your role will be critical in partnering with finance, sales, service, and IT teams to align data initiatives with business goals, acting as a data management expert and effectively communicating your findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Additionally, your dedication to data protection and privacy compliance will ensure our business information remains secure and trustworthy.

Your Key Responsibilities

Create, implement, and manage data integration workflows using SQL Integration Services
Develop multidimensional cubes and tabular models in SQL Analysis Services
Generate and distribute reports using SQL Reporting Services
Perform in-depth data analysis and generate insights to support business decisions
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Tableau
Work with large datasets and ensure data integrity and quality
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide solutions
Create comprehensive documentation and reports to communicate insights and recommendations
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security across all BI systems
Continuously improve BI processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness



Who You Are

Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role
Proven experience with Microsoft SQL Server (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, or a related field
Preferred: Experience with Snowflake database
Preferred: Experience developing reports and dashboards using Tableau
Preferred: Familiarity with data structures in SAP


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Data Analyst | Join a Fast-Growing FoodTech Startup in Madrid







üëã Who are we?

Founded in 2012, Take a Chef was born from the belief that exceptional culinary experiences should be accessible beyond traditional restaurant settings.

We envisioned a world where top-tier chefs could bring their talents directly to the dining tables of discerning individuals and families. üçΩÔ∏è

Combining cutting-edge technology üíª with a deep passion for food and hospitality ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•, we‚Äôve become the leading global platform for high-quality private chef services.

Last year, we served over 500,000 clients in more than 100+ countries, working with a network of 60,000+ private chefs and partnering with renowned luxury travel brands like Airbnb, Onefinestay, Le Collectionist and more. ‚ú®







üéØ About the role

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who‚Äôs passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights. If you love understanding business challenges, building dashboards, and automating data processes to empower decision-making across teams‚Äîthis might be your next role.







üõ†Ô∏è Responsibilities

üîç Deeply understand our business, products, and processes through data
üìä Create and maintain dashboards to track key metrics and visualize insights
üìà Generate reports and visualizations to communicate findings with clarity and impact
ü§ù Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, Design, and Marketing to support their data needs
üß∞ Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction using Python, SQL, and APIs







‚úÖ Requirements

üéì Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics)
üíº At least 2 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
üß† Strong experience (2+ years) with SQL, BigQuery, and Dataflow
üìà Hands-on experience (2+ years) with HubSpot and Amplitude
üöÄ Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, autonomous environment
üåç Fluency in English and Spanish
üìä Nice to have: Experience with BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI







Why choose us?

üíº Positive Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that values personal well-being and team spirit.
‚öñÔ∏è Work-Life Balance: We prioritize flexibility and support so you can flourish both professionally and personally.
üìö Employee Development: Paid training and workshops to help you grow and achieve your career goals.
üí∞ Competitive Compensation: We offer attractive salaries and annual bonuses to reward your impact.
üå¥ Paid Time Off: Enjoy 25 vacation days per year to relax, recharge, and explore your passions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

MSX International Group‚ÄØis the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI‚Äôs deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.

Job Description

As Data Analyst the primary responsibility of this role will be manage and track requests related to lead management, IT reporting, and data analysis, acting as the key contact between different stakeholders, internal and externally.

Key Tasks


Manage and track requests made to external provider / system providers for Lead management, IT reporting topics, and data analysis.
Serve as a point of contact between the different stakeholders.
Coordinate the development and implementation of new solutions required by both the external and internal client with the provider.
Review lead numbers reflected in reporting platforms and ensure those figures accurately match reality.
Propose solutions to help correct errors in data reporting.
Participate in the development of solutions with AI functionalities, e.g., chatbots, knowledge database.


Qualifications


You possess a degree in a relevant field such as: IT, Computer Science, Information System, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics or related fields.
Experience with Data & Integration.
Knowledge and experience about AI tools, predictions, statistics.
Experience with html.
You have a good level of English at least C1 is required.
You have strong interpersonal skills, you are open minded, you enjoy working in a Team environment and you possess excellent communication skills and excellent analytical skills.
You are proficient in MS Office365 applications.


Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Internship, Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern for our dynamic market Intelligence team.

Responsibilities


Search for opportunities for business development and increase of company's market share in different services
Regular analysis of the company's performance
Convert the information into knowledge in order to increase company's competitiveness
Develop and maintain regulatory databases
Create, update and organize database of potential international customers
Support regional teams across the globe
Attend meetings with sales and business development managers based internationally


Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration / Data Analysis / Economics/ International Business.
Knowledge in Big Data a plus.
Fluent in English, Intermediate in Spanish.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft windows applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
MI tools such as Power Bi, MACRO, Data Scrapping tools are preferred.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Willing to learn.
Proactive, organized, and multitasking with great team spirit.
Mission: At UL, we know why we come to work. Shape the way we approach and deliver our solutions to have a meaningful contribution to society.
People: Be part of our global team and do your best work! Teamwork, open-feedback and our diversity are our drivers to reach our common mission.
Interesting work: The work that goes on inside UL is fuelling the future. It challenges you to try fresh approaches, work autonomously, drive change and gain in-depth experience in your field.
Grow & achieve: Growth and development are part of our DNA. Grow & achieve with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as your very own UL University.
This is our normal: Competitive remuneration, annual bonus, flexible hours, home office options, paid annual leave.


About Us

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions (NYSE: ULS) transforms safety, security and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 110 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers‚Äô product innovation and business growth. The UL Mark serves as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers‚Äô products and reflects an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. Our science is your advantage.

Our science is your advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Unimedia Technology, we're on the lookout for a Data Analyst to work on the next-gen digital signage and advertising platform used by major clients across Europe.




üéØ What You‚Äôll Do

As a Data Specialist, you‚Äôll be crucial to making sure the geographic and postal data is clean, accurate, and ready to go. Here's a taste of your day-to-day:

‚óè üåê Research and scrape geographic, postal data and point-of-interest sources, integrating them into the systems.

‚óè üßπ Perform data cleaning, validation, and integration into our PostgreSQL database.

‚óè üß© Collaborate on internal projects with the team to process and analyze data effectively.

‚óè üó∫ Work closely with the Product Owner and Development to ensure data accuracy and relevance.

‚óè üìù Document your workflows and processes to keep things running smoothly.




ü§π You‚Äôll Fit Right In If You...

‚óè Have strong proficiency in SQL and experience with PostgreSQL (you‚Äôre comfortable writing queries like a pro).

‚óè Know your way around data processing and automation (bonus if you‚Äôve automated workflows before).

‚óè Have excellent written and spoken English communication skills

‚óè Hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or higher) in a relevant field.

‚óè Have a good handling of Python or similar







üí• Nice-to-Haves

‚óè Experience with GIS (Geographical Information Systems) tools like QGIS or similar platforms.

‚óè Some familiarity with bash scripting and Git for version control.

‚óè Hands-on knowledge of web scraping tools and techniques (because sometimes the best data is hiding on the web).

‚óè A basic understanding of PHP (for occasional integrations).

‚óè Fluency in additional languages, especially those useful in international postal systems.

Title: Business Intelligence Trainee
Description:
Company Description

At Accor, we are more than just a global leader; we embrace individuality and empower you to find a role and brand that resonate with your unique personality. Our commitment to your growth and learning ensures that your work is meaningful, allowing you to explore the endless possibilities that await you within our organization.

With a presence in 110 countries and over 5,000 hotels, Accor offers endless opportunities within its global network. Every day, we work together to shape the future of hospitality with a shared sense of purpose.

Job Description

Are you passionate about data and eager to apply it in a fast-paced, exciting industry like hospitality?

This is your opportunity to dive into one of the most vibrant and dynamic sectors, where every data point matters and each analysis has the power to enhance the experience of thousands of guests.

What will you do on this journey?


Collect and structure data from various internal sources (booking systems, PMS, satisfaction surveys, etc.).
Design impactful and visually appealing dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau to help understand customer behavior, occupancy trends, revenue, and more.
Contribute to strategic analyses related to profitability, seasonality, and operational efficiency.
Automate key reports for operations, marketing, and management teams.
Collaborate with different departments to understand how data can drive better decision-making in hotels, restaurants, or event venues.
Take part in documenting and standardizing analytical processes within the department.


Qualifications

What we‚Äôre looking for


A current student or recent graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Business Administration, or a related field.
Strong command of Excel. Basic knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Familiarity with or curiosity about BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Willingness to learn, strong analytical mindset, and results-oriented approach.
A genuine interest in discovering how the hospitality business works "from the inside," supporting decision-making through real data insights.
It is essential to be able to sign an internship agreement with a university or educational institution.
6-month internship duration.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

We are Ambar Soluciones SA, a company based in Barcelona, ready to support your successful fintech career. We provide financial market participants around the globe with services for financial and data analytics, IT development, and maintenance. We aim to create a modern and comfortable IT environment for our clients.




We are always in search of highly qualified specialists. Join us if you are looking for a dynamic company that cares about its employees. We offer multiple benefits for your continuous development, well-being, comfort, and career opportunities. And don‚Äôt forget about our free lunches :)

Work with us‚Äîboost your skills!




About the role:

Highly skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our FPA team. The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical skills, proficiency in data visualization tools, and a passion for transforming raw data into valuable business intelligence.




What will you do?

Provide cross-functional analytical support, including advanced reporting, data analysis, and data management
Participate in the design of data architecture, the design of future pipelines
Design and maintain dashboards financial reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, specifically Finance, to understand business needs and assist in developing data-driven solutions and prepare information for ad-hoc requests
Participate and work on automation




What experience and skills are we looking for:

2+ years of working experience on the position Data Analyst or Data Engineering
SQL proficiency (BigQuery experience would be preferable)
Working experience with data/task orchestration tools, ETL (Airflow will be a plus )
Knowledge and experience with data visualisation tools for designing reports (Tableau experience would be preferable)
Readiness to work with large amounts of data and complex data pipelines
Python knowledge for Data Analytics (Data Engineering)
Previous experience with Oracle database would be a plus




SOFT Skills

Vivid interest in the automation area
Fluent English (Russian will be a plus)
Strong analytical thinking, curiosity, and a proactive approach to problem-solving
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
Effective Time management working with a high workload and ad-hoc tasks




Benefits:

From your first day:

Competitive salary based on experience and skills
Healthy lunches from our catering partners (gluten-free, lactose-free, vegetarian, and vegan options available).
Daily fresh fruits, healthy snacks, and a fully stocked kitchen.
A computer of your choice (Windows or Mac)
No dress code policy
Free Parking Space for your car
Flexible Working Schedule (you don‚Äôt have to be worried about running 5 minutes late)
100% Covered 30 days/year of sick days
Career development according to business needs
Team buildings and two corporate parties a year!
23 Paid Vacation Business Days

After a probation period:

Private health insurance
Coverage for up to 50% of your language classes, sports membership, and mental health support.

Relocating to Barcelona? We will cover the cost of:




Transportation costs from the place of permanent residence to Barcelona.
Accommodation for the first 30 days (so you don't have to stress about where to stay)
Real estate agency fees

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist - Data Science (Openbank)
Description:
Country: Spain

Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.

If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!

Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team‚Äôs efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.

You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you‚Äôll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.

You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.

To be successful in the role you must bring:


At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
You can give and take criticism well. You don‚Äôt get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you‚Äôre polite enough to challenge others‚Äô ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don‚Äôt know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.


What do we offer?


Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

#OPENBANK

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 55+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Welcome to this recruitment process with Vueling!

Applying is your first step to having the opportunity to join the first Top Employer airline in Europe. We hope the information you find here encourages you to apply so we can get to know you and stay connected.

Let's start by getting to know us better!

At Vueling, we love things to happen. We always do our best to go one step further and do it better. We invite our people to celebrate their unique strengths, work as a team to overcome challenges and achieve their goals for the greater good.

Our team is made of great professionals. Great and passionate people who collaborate, support and complement each other's skills.

We are one of Europe's leading low-cost airlines, with special relevance in the Spanish domestic market, as well as in France and Italy.

Job Purpose

The Performance and Projects team drives key initiatives to improve customer experience and business performance through strategic insight. In this role, you'll turn complex data into meaningful insights, enabling better decision-making and measurable improvements across the customer journey. Your work will directly contribute to transforming how we understand and serve our customers.

Main Accountabilities


Deliver insights that improve customer experience and business performance.
Champion NPS across the business ‚Äî own its analysis, visibility, and impact.
Build and evolve dashboards that bring NPS and other key metrics to life for teams (e.g. Ops, Commercial, Customer).
Support strategic projects with clear, data-backed recommendations.
Help teams across the business become more data-driven in their decisions.
Continuously improve the quality, clarity, and actionability of performance reporting.


Main Responsibilities - Tasks


Analyse customer and operational data to uncover trends, patterns, and improvement opportunities.
Develop and maintain impactful dashboards and reports.
Produce recurring and ad-hoc reports to track performance metrics and support business decisions.
Translate complex findings into clear, actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Customer, Data, Commercial, Network, Strategy) to support project delivery.
Ensure consistent, high-quality reporting with a focus on automation and reusability.


Main Relationships


Customer Experience, Commercial, Network, and Strategy Teams
Data & Analytics Teams


Education


Higher education in a relevant field (e.g. Statistics, Engineering, Business, or similar)


Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis


Competencies


Strong analytical skills and critical thinking
Advanced Excel
Proficient in data visualisation tools (Tableau or Power BI)
Working knowledge of R or Python is a plus
Understanding of data structures and modelling concepts
Skilled at creating clear reports and compelling presentations
Accuracy, attention to detail, and the ability to explain data to non-technical audiences
Self-motivated, curious, and comfortable managing multiple priorities


Languages

Spanish and English (minimum B2)

Location

Viladecans, Barcelona

Level

Individual Contributor 5

We are the only Top Employer airline in Europe

For the second year running, Vueling is the only European airline and the only low-cost airline in the world to obtain this certification. The Top Employers Institute programme certifies organisations based on the participation and results of their HR Best Practices Survey. This survey covers six HR domains consisting of 20 topics including People Strategy, Work Environment, Talent Acquisition, Learning, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Wellbeing and more.

üü° #FlyToYourFullPotential

Every single person who works with us is unique. Join us is accepting the invite to fly to your full potential through self-development and pursuing your professional passion. Our employee value proposition and benefits include staff travel, discounts, a flexible working model, and more! Want to learn more? Click here.

üü° Our Culture

We thrive on teamwork and collaboration. Joining our team means being part of a cohesive unit that works together, shares knowledge, and supports each other.

Our positive working atmosphere is unique and essential to our productivity and growth. You'll be surrounded by diverse and dynamic professionals. We are passionate about what we do: Connecting People and Places! Learn more about our Mission, Vision, & Values.

üü° Our Recruitment Process

Your experience as a candidate is critical for us. We firmly believe that understanding our process will alleviate anxiety and ignite your passion for this extraordinary experience! Please take a closer look at how our process works.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst plays a crucial role in consolidating, analyzing, and optimizing operational and financial reporting across multiple countries. This role ensures accurate data insights for process improvements and acts as a bridge between IT and operational teams. Additionally, the Senior Analyst serves as a Project Management Office (PMO) coordinator, ensuring smooth project execution and process documentation. The position also involves developing and delivering interactive training sessions to enhance data literacy and process understanding within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, consolidate, and analyze reports from multiple regions to identify trends and performance gaps.
Develop data visualization dashboards and user-friendly reporting tools to improve decision-making.
Identify key data trends and detect anomalies (red flags), providing corrective action recommendations.
Collaborate with IT to ensure process flows are aligned with system capabilities and automation strategies.
Act as a PMO coordinator, tracking project timelines, milestones, and resource allocations.
Document operational processes, ensuring clear and structured process flows.
Support change management initiatives, driving seamless adoption of new systems and reporting structures.
Design and deliver interactive training sessions to enhance data analytics capabilities across teams.
Conduct workshops and hands-on sessions to ensure proper use of reporting tools and dashboards.
Travel regionally to support teams in implementing new data-driven initiatives and provide on-site training when needed.




Qualifications & Experience:

Degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in multinational environments, handling regional data reporting and analytics.
Strong expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and Power BI.
Background in project management, process documentation, and training facilitation.
Familiarity with finance, business analysis, or operational performance tracking.
Fluent English required; additional languages are a plus.




Key Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
High proficiency in data visualization and reporting.
Experience in process improvement and workflow optimization.
Strong project management and change management skills.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across different teams and cultures.
Capability to design and conduct training programs, using interactive methodologies to engage learners.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




Cheil Worldwide is a full-service agency from brand building to digital transformations creating excellent data-driven experiences for every customer. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Spain plays its part in one of the world‚Äôs biggest agency networks ‚Äì comprising 53 offices and 8 affiliates in 43 countries globally with more than 6.000 employees and 600 clients around the world. Cheil Spain is made up of 100 employees from different disciplines, who are passionate about innovation in all its forms. We offer a wide variety of marketing and advertising services, including strategy and planning, creative, content production, traditional and digital media advertising, influencer marketing, event marketing, e-commerce and performance marketing, among others.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Analyst




‚úîÔ∏è What we are looking for?




We are looking for a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Performance team at Cheil Spain. This role will play a critical part in unlocking insights from web and CRM data to improve user experiences, increase conversions, and inform strategic decisions for Samsung Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate has strong expertise in Adobe Analytics and GA4, and a solid understanding of user behavior analysis, segmentation, and digital marketing KPIs. Bonus if you're familiar with SQL, Python, BigQuery, and Qlik.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Responsibilities:




Support CRM and performance initiatives through audience segmentation, behavior analysis, and campaign performance reporting.
Evaluate Campaigns, promotions, marketing channels attribution, the funnel, and much more for the understanding of the customer journey, identifying insights with clear business recommendations
Analyze user journeys and web behavior through Adobe Analytics and GA4 to identify performance trends, drop-offs, and optimization opportunities.
Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Adobe Workspace, Looker Studio, or Power BI to track performance and support internal and client decision-making.
Collaborate closely with UX, CRO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to align data strategies and contribute with actionable insights.
Define KPIs and measurement frameworks for digital marketing initiatives and validate technical tracking implementations (with support from GTM specialists if needed).
Deliver recurring and ad hoc reports for always-on and campaign-based activities, including funnel analysis, campaign attribution, and ecommerce performance.
Present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, connecting data findings with business objectives.
Continuously monitor data quality, track implementation, and propose process improvements to strengthen data-driven decision-making.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Skills & requirements:




4+ years in a Digital Data Analyst role, ideally within an agency or ecommerce environment.
Advanced expertise in Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics 4.
Proven ability to extract, visualize, and present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience building dashboards and reports using Looker Studio or Power BI.
Strong understanding of digital marketing campaigns, ecommerce KPIs, and data quality validation.
Excellent storytelling and presentation skills in PowerPoint.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a strategic business mindset.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python for data querying and automation tasks.
Understanding of website tagging and event tracking via Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager or other CDP tools.
Previous exposure to e-commerce platforms and CRO/UX concepts.
Familiarity with A/B testing frameworks and marketing attribution models.
Fluent in Spanish and English.




Languages:

C1 level of English required, with advanced English writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with international teams and external suppliers.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Specialized training and continuous professional development.
Social benefits and flexible compensation plan.

Ensure data quality and integrity by performing regular data validation and cleansing.
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques to continuously improve our data analytics capabilities.

Requirements:




Minimum 3-5 years of experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and working with Gitlab.
Experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, and microservices architectures is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




We positively value all work or study experience abroad.

All positions require a high level of English (at least B2) - please send your detailed CV in English.
