Title: Data Analyst - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As a RISK Reporting Data Analyst, you will be responsible for producing BCEF‚Äôs RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in cooperation with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also contribute to the production of credit risk reporting and indicators to address increasing regulatory demands and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank‚Äôs credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines ‚Äì LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


During monthly and quarterly financial closings
Production of controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall) to critically assess the elements used in capital calculation
Identification of potential anomalies during the capital run and making necessary corrections
Production of dashboards to explain RWA amounts and their variations
Analysis and explanation of results from both an internal and standard approach (following the implementation of Basel 4 in January 2025), including the preparation of presentation materials
Post-financial closings, you will lead work to optimize BCEF‚Äôs RWA
Analyze and track the impact of compensations (RISK/Finance discrepancies) to reduce them in collaboration with the Finance teams in Madrid
Analyze risk parameters (freshness of ratings and RTS36 impacts, limiting risk parameters for defaulted items or those subject to management rules)
Contribute to improving the quality of data used (e.g., analyzing collateral, tracking remediation actions on data quality controls (Defensive and RDI controls), participating in the Data Quality Committee (COMET))
Finally, you will also contribute to the production of risk reporting and indicators
Produce and analyze credit risk indicators for recharges or new securitization vehicles to meet internal and regulatory requirements (including the future SLA between RISK BCEF and ALMT)
Produce regular regulatory reports (e.g., Short Term Exercise, Loan Tape CRE) or ad-hoc reports (e.g., BCE requests) in cooperation with the Paris reporting teams

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Tableau
Power BI
SQL
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to manage a project
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Main Tasks And Responsibilities

Noesis is looking for candidates with the following profile:

  • Daily analysis of indicators for each ATM;
  • Daily generation of supply orders based on consumption needs;
  • Analysis of supplier invoices, validating them against purchase orders and other relevant criteria;
  • Preparation of content, presentations, documents, and reports for both external and internal clients.

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science or similar;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel and Access);
  • Proficiency in SQL Server and T-SQL;
  • Previous experience in statistical analysis of indicators, including the identification of trends and patterns;
  • Proactivity and dynamism;
  • Organizational and communication skills;
  • Knowledge of English.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Intro

At Pleo, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We‚Äôre creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation ‚Äì which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you‚Äôll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics Hub at Pleo. In this role, you‚Äôll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your insights will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What will you be doing

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:


Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Gain a deep understanding of our customers needs and experiences to identify opportunities to improve customer experience CX
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Supporting our data governance initiatives, aligning measurement and metrics across business areas domains
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What you bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Senior Data Analyst with a strong product analytics background, ideally in a fintech/SaaS company
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have deep experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML, and product analytics tools such as Amplitude
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Have strong statistical knowledge, with experience in experimentation at scale
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Harness your understanding of business and product strategy, to provide actionable, insightful recommendations
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail.


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office üçú
Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or M√©dis
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work üë∂


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‚Äòmore than you‚Äôd expect‚Äô, and it‚Äôs been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it‚Äôs only fitting that we‚Äôd pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn‚Äôt be siloed from the rest of the organisation ‚Äì they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‚Äòchampion the customer‚Äô, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‚Äòsucceed as a team‚Äô, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‚Äòmake it happen‚Äô by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‚Äòbuild to scale‚Äô, creating lasting solutions that address today‚Äôs challenges and anticipate tomorrow‚Äôs needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices ‚Äîand quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it‚Äôs our company language so you‚Äôll be speaking lots of it if you join üíï
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone üòä
We‚Äôre on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That‚Äôs only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Senior (M/W)
Description:
Company Description

VANTIVA, headquartered in Paris, France and formerly known as Technicolor, is a global technology leader in designing, developing and supplying innovative products and solutions that connect consumers around the world to the content and services they love ‚Äì whether at home, at work or in other smart spaces.

VANTIVA has also earned a solid reputation for optimizing supply chain performance by leveraging its decades-long expertise in high-precision manufacturing, logistics, fulfilment and distribution. With operations throughout the Americas, Asia Pacific and EMEA, VANTIVA is recognized as a strategic partner by leading firms across various vertical industries, including network service providers, software companies and video game creators for over 25 years.

Our relationships with the film and entertainment industry goes back over 100 years by providing end-to-end solutions for our clients. VANTIVA is committed to the highest standards of corporate social responsibility and sustainability across all aspects of their operations.

For more information, please visit www.vantiva.com

Job Description

The BI expert will contribute to all aspects of BI development, covering Vantiva applications and supporting the implementation of the data strategy roadmap.

This role is critical in designing, developing, and maintaining data warehousing, reporting solutions, and BI applications. It requires a strong foundation in business intelligence, analytics, and functional expertise to interpret business requirements effectively.

The candidate will drive solution design, customization, and development to resolve issues, enhance existing solutions, and deliver new business intelligence capabilities.

The ideal candidate thrives in complex technical environments, enjoys problem-solving, and is passionate about data and analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Align and implement data architecture to support data analytics, reporting needs, and business planning requirements.
Ensure BI system health and performance by proposing, implementing, and monitoring best practices.
Maintain data reliability across all layers of the data platform and satellite systems.
Develop best practices for data visualization, dashboarding, planning, analytics, and application architecture.
Conduct root cause analysis and provide recommendations to leadership to mitigate risks and improve efficiency.
Ensure compliance with core solution principles and industry regulations for data handling and reporting.
Implement and maintain data security measures to protect sensitive information.
Handle user support requests, prioritizing them based on business impact.
Perform necessary system configurations and developments as needed.
Collaborate extensively with business stakeholders to understand reporting & analytics needs and deliver solutions that meet their requirements.


Qualifications


Highly motivated, proactive, and a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Strong experience in analyzing, diagnosing, designing, planning, executing, and evaluating BI solutions while meeting time, cost, and quality targets.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and documentation skills.
10+ years of experience in data foundation, data management, data governance, and insights generation.
Senior-level expertise in SAP BI architecture and development tools, with a focus on BW/4HANA.
Hands-on experience with BW/4HANA, IP/BPC, SAC, BODS, BOBJ (Webi), and Analysis for Excel.
Exposure to HANA administration, including data provisioning, data tiering, security, and performance optimization.
Proficiency in ABAP development is required (programs, functions, object classes, WebDynpro).
Strong SQL skills with experience in query performance tuning.
Knowledge of MS Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and Data Factory is an advantage.
Databricks experience is a strong plus completed by a proficiency in Python.


Additional Information

The position is located in Lisbon, Portugal.

Our most important asset is our People

Vantiva‚Äôs success greatly relies on our people‚Äôs energy, motivation, and talent.

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Intro

At Pleo, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We‚Äôre creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation ‚Äì which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you‚Äôll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics Hub at Pleo. In this role, you‚Äôll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your insights will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What will you be doing

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:


Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Gain a deep understanding of our customers needs and experiences to identify opportunities to improve customer experience CX
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Supporting our data governance initiatives, aligning measurement and metrics across business areas domains
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What you bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Senior Data Analyst with a strong product analytics background, ideally in a fintech/SaaS company
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have deep experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML, and product analytics tools such as Amplitude
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Have strong statistical knowledge, with experience in experimentation at scale
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Harness your understanding of business and product strategy, to provide actionable, insightful recommendations
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail.


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office üçú
Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or M√©dis
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work üë∂


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‚Äòmore than you‚Äôd expect‚Äô, and it‚Äôs been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it‚Äôs only fitting that we‚Äôd pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn‚Äôt be siloed from the rest of the organisation ‚Äì they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‚Äòchampion the customer‚Äô, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‚Äòsucceed as a team‚Äô, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‚Äòmake it happen‚Äô by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‚Äòbuild to scale‚Äô, creating lasting solutions that address today‚Äôs challenges and anticipate tomorrow‚Äôs needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices ‚Äîand quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it‚Äôs our company language so you‚Äôll be speaking lots of it if you join üíï
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone üòä
We‚Äôre on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That‚Äôs only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Main tasks:


Analyses, plans, implements and technically tests IT solutions in the context of projects within the scope of the DataWarehouse.
Ensures the formalization and ensures that documentation is completed in accordance with current procedures.
Occasionally participates in meetings with the Business Areas and in working sessions with the team responsible for functional definition, carrying out certification/quality tests and monitoring UAT tests.
Proposes improvements to management platforms and tools, with the aim of optimizing and innovating them.
Formalize and documents the technical analyses it carries out, the technical solutions it implements, the technical tests it performs and the decision-making meetings it participates in.
Communicates and validates its activities and decisions with the person in charge, thus ensuring that they are aligned with the department's recommendations in terms of posture and Roadmap.
Reports to the Data Hub Chapter.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Knowledge of programming Microsoft BI Tolls
SQL/T-SQL
Power Bi
Jira/Confluence/ Draw IO
Knowledge of applications from a user perspective: MS Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or similar areas.
Experience in Datawarehouse solutions, with an understanding of all phases of construction.
Minimum of 6 years of experience in functional/technical analysis and definition of corporate data models.
Analytical skills and clear skills for conceptual designs that respond transversally to the Datawarehouse.
Experience in projects/environments with Agile framework.
Preference for experience in models with Data Vault methodology.
Preference for experience in the Banking area (consumer credit)


Language Skills


Portuguese
English


Additional Information

Soft skills:

Strong communication and organizational skills

Ability to gather requirements, document and lead meetings

Autonomy and proactivity. Critical thinking

Ability to synthesize and solve problems. Adaptability and resilience

Focus on the customer and delivering results
Show more

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) will be home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP will offer rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe‚Äôs most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo ‚Äì Sete Rios, Av. Jos√© Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you‚Äôre part of something bigger, it‚Äôs because you are. At Amgen our shared mission‚Äîto serve patients‚Äîdrives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world‚Äôs leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together‚Äîresearching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It‚Äôs time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Associate Field Excellence/Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Associate Field Excellence, will support the delivery of day to day D&A activities and delivery of sales and activities data to the country teams. The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and Amgen.

Some of the tasks related to that are:


Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)
Developing new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of Amgen‚Äôs products.
Providing support on the internal CRM system
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams
Build data governance with scalable processes, refresh scheduling, security, and monitoring of report quality
Providing training and support on the internal CRM system.
Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes.
Support on capacity calculation and territories
Write Technical documentation of data models and applications
Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Healthcare, Business or Data
1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Strong knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
Communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Medium knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
Medium to High knowledge of SQL


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Knowledge of at least one ETL (Alteryx and Tableau Prep preferred)
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Show more

  • Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes.
  • Support on capacity calculation and territories
  • Write Technical documentation of data models and applications
  • Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
  • Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
  • Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).

WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:

  • University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Healthcare, Business or Data
  • 1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
  • Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
  • Consistent track record of achieving desired results
  • Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
  • Communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Medium knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
  • Medium to High knowledge of SQL

Preferred Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
  • Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
  • Knowledge of at least one ETL (Alteryx and Tableau Prep preferred)
  • Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.

THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us

  • Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
  • A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
  • Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
  • Flexible work arrangements.

APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Department: People Tech & Development

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: German Korenblum

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save by reshaping their relationship with money. We‚Äôre the region‚Äôs leading Buy Now, Pay Later solution, trusted by millions of shoppers and thousands of brands like Amazon, IKEA, and Shein.

We‚Äôre a team of bold thinkers and doers, building a category-defining fintech across MENA‚Äîand we‚Äôre just getting started.

We‚Äôre looking for a data-savvy problem solver to join our People team as an HR Data Analyst. If you love making sense of data, spotting trends, and turning insights into impact‚Äîthis one‚Äôs for you.

At Tabby, our people are at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you‚Äôll help us understand, measure, and improve the entire employee experience‚Äîfrom hiring to retention and everything in between.

üîç What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Build and maintain clear, insightful dashboards and reports across the employee lifecycle.
Dig into HR data (think: hiring, attrition, engagement, performance) and find the stories behind the numbers.
Partner with HR, Finance, and Leadership to support strategic workforce planning and decision-making.
Track key HR metrics (time-to-hire, attrition, headcount growth, DEI stats, etc.) and flag trends early.
Ensure data quality across our HR systems, and help streamline and automate reporting workflows.
Run deep-dive analyses and present findings in a way that drives action, not just information.
Be our go-to person for all things HR analytics.



üß† What You‚Äôll Bring


2‚Äì4 years of experience in HR analytics, people operations, or a related data role.
You‚Äôre fluent in spreadsheets (Excel or Google Sheets) and can tell a story with numbers.
Hands-on experience with HR systems (HRIS, ATS), BigQuery, and visualization tools ( Looker, Power BI, etc.).
A natural curiosity and sharp eye for spotting patterns, gaps, and opportunities.
Clear communication skills‚Äîyou can turn complex findings into simple narratives.
Bonus points if you‚Äôve worked in a startup, tech, or fintech environment.



üí° Why You‚Äôll Love Working at Tabby


You‚Äôll be part of a fast-growing team where ideas move fast and your work truly matters.
You‚Äôll help shape how data drives people strategy in a company where culture is everything.
We offer competitive compensation, flexibility, and a no-BS, high-trust environment.
You‚Äôll join a smart, international team that‚Äôs curious, humble, and obsessed with building something great.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.

Your main activies are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders.


Behavioral Skills

Profile and skills to success


Ability to synthetize/simplify: Expert
Communication skills - oral & written: Expert
Ability to deliver/Results driven: Expert


Transversal Skills


Analytical Ability: Expert
Ability to manage a project: Proficient


Business Skills


Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics - Business Analytics: Expert


Languages


English (Fluent)


Tools and Methodologies


DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Expert)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT MICROSOFT SQL Server (Expert)


Experience, Academic Background & Other Qualifications

Field of Expertise


Data Analytics ([3 - 4] years)


Academic Background


Masters in Mathematics and Statistics
Masters in Information Technology and Computer Science


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: STDA Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team‚Äôs responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9


Your Main Activities Are


Perform data collection and build/maintain reliable data pipelines
Work on data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
Build and optimize the data processing, being in charge of sourcing and connecting data
Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises


Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Information Technology / Data Analytics / Engineering or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Data exploration and data preparation
SQL
Python
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to deliver/Results driven
Ability to work with tight deadlines and multidisciplinary teams
Analytical ability
Attention to detail / rigor
Communication skills, both written and oral
Resilience

Why joining BNP Paribas?

BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. Title: Analytic Consultant
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currently searching for a Analytic Consultant for the Intelligence Analytics (iA) ‚Äì Price & Promotion Team.

You will work together with some of the largest FMCG companies, helping them to make the right choices for their price and promo strategy, considering the impact on sales and P&L.

You will manage the Price and Promo projects, working together with the executive teams, analyzing the outputs of the projects, and providing insightful price and promo recommendations.

Your insights will influence decisions for some of today‚Äôs leading global companies.

You will have the opportunity to be part of the PnP NielsenIQ service transformation.

Responsibilities


Be part of an international project team that helps FMCG clients optimizing their pricing and promotion activities ‚Äì cover Clients in Europe, Middle East, and Africa
Convert analytical results into a business-focused and actionable client report
Use Nielsen tools and methodologies to build answers to business questions based on the market data and revenue management analysis
Deliver insights and recommendations to the client in a presentation
Coordinate project execution between NIQ teams of experts


Qualifications


Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree with a preference to Business, Economics or Mathematics
2-3 year‚Äôs previous FMCG / research or consulting agency experience would be a plus
Strong analytical skills and numerical reasoning
Strong organizational, communication & interpersonal skills
Focused on helping the client win in the market
Ability to travel to deliver insights and recommendations presentations
Strong Business English knowledge, both verbal and written (another European Language would be an asset);


WHAT DO WE OFFER?

Besides an attractive salary & compensation package, NIQ offers flexible working hours and working from home, helping you to create a work/life balance that fits the best for your personal situation. Moreover, you will experience a dynamic, open, international and solution-oriented environment. You will be trained on-the-job to develop your skills and experience.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Data Analyst main mission is to create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Masters in Mathematics and Statistics or Information Technology and Computer Science
Up to 2 years of professional experience in Data Analytics
Proficiency of Data Viz Blending Analytics Tableau, Power BI and SQL
Fluent in English
Good communication skills with the ability to synthetize and simplify
Analytical ability and ability to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Join Us at Closer Consulting!

Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation ‚Äì we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home. We provide our people with the means, opportunities, and support they need to thrive and innovate. ‚ú®

For this position, it is necessary to have a residence in Lisbon, PT.

We seek a Data Analyst professional who is willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid project.

What You'll Be Doing


Design and maintain business dashboards and impactful data visualizations
Analyze large and complex datasets to support strategic and operational decisions
Build and optimize data pipelines using Airflow, SQL, and Python
Ensure data quality and consistency across referential sources ‚úÖ
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand needs and deliver insights
Support continuous improvement of data processes and analytical tools
Work in Agile teams and contribute to the evolution of third-party data ecosystems ‚öôÔ∏è‚òÅÔ∏è


What We're Looking For


6+ years of experience in data analysis, functional/technical specification, and data modeling
Advanced skills in SQL, Python, and PySpark
Experience with Oracle databases (SQL Server/PostgreSQL is a plus)
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, or other visualization tools
Familiarity with Airflow for pipeline orchestration ‚è±Ô∏è
Experience in Data Warehousing and file formats like Parquet
Ability to work with APIs and knowledge of Git is a plus
Solid grasp of Agile methodologies (SCRUM)


Soft Skills That Matter


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management Ô∏è
Proactivity, autonomy, and adaptability
Attention to detail and ability to synthesize information
Team spirit and client orientation


Languages

English ‚Äì Fluent (preferred)

French ‚Äì Intermediate (nice to have)

Portuguese ‚Äì Fluent (mandatory)

Nice To Have


Knowledge of referential data and banking domain (consumer credit)
Tools like Jira, Confluence, and Draw.IO for documentation and collaboration


We Believe We Are The Ones To


Providing a multidisciplinary Team
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth
Providing you with a custom training plan
Helping you reach happiness


Oh‚Ä¶ And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects
Stimulating teams and leaders
World-class Clients and Partners


If you enjoy turning data into business-driving decisions, we'd like to talk to you. Send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and discover the closer side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Risk Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK is to provide Senior Management of the Group and of the Operating Divisions, with full transparency and dynamic analysis of the risk and clients managed by Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) and Investment Solutions (IS) business units. RISK contributes to the definition of the Group‚Äôs risk appetite, its risk decision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to support the development of the Operating Divisions
RISK Systems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with a comprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market and counterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support the needs of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process. In this context, RISK Systems Operations team is a global team responsible for the production of market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function
Operations team is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systems of the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the quality aspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues are resolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) about data quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, and assisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs are discussed
The mission of Operations team is met by:
Ensuring clients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of the services provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningful KPIs about our main services
Resolution of incidents related to data quality, what regularly involves investigation and coordination with other teams
Running, streamlining, documenting existing processes and improving them once we detect any opportunities to do so
The role is for a position within the Operations team in Lisbon, Portugal


Your Main Activities Are


Work on Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance and monitoring Indicators about the availability and quality of the data in our systems, and maintaining these KPIs
Investigate issues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently
Build close links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients
Provide training and guidance to new users of the system where required


Profile and Skills to Success


Master‚Äôs Degree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
Years of relevant experience
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
MS Office Pack (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
SQL
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to deliver / results driven
Organisational skills
Proactivity

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data & BI Developer
Description:
A SynchroTech

recruta um Data Engineer (Databricks) para uma empresa cliente, premiada, especializada em projetos de consultoria e outsourcing em IT, em Lisboa.

Engenharia de dados em ambiente Microsoft Azure.

Integra√ß√£o de dados com ferramentas anal√≠ticas (incluindo Microsoft Fabric e Power BI).

Title: Data Documentalist / Data Governance
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Support the build-up of Data Catalog, enhancing the completeness and accuracy of Data Dictionary, Business Glossary, Data Lineage, Data Classification and Governance.


Essential Skills


At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
Experience of reading technical documentation for systems;
Experience of creating data dictionaries, business glossaries and data governance models;
Good knowledge of Python and SQL;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply


The candidate must be resident in Portugal.

Title: Senior Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
Intro

At Pleo, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We‚Äôre creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation ‚Äì which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you‚Äôll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Full Stack Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team. You‚Äôll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your data expertise & insight generations will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What will you be doing

As a Senior Full Stack Data Analyst, you will:


Building end-to-end analytics solutions, using data modelling, analytics techniques and data visualisation to power Pleo
Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What you bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced data practitioner with a dual background in analytics and analytics engineering within a fast-paced environment, preferably fintech
Possess expert technical skills and experience with tools such as advanced SQL, dbt, BigQuery, Looker (and LookML)
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Like to be involved in both engineering excellent products and understanding business and product challenges with analytics.
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail
Are highly familiar with CI/CD processes and understand their importance in maintaining data integrity


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, and London offices, or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets üçú
Private health insurance to ensure you‚Äôre fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We‚Äôre trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work üë∂


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‚Äòmore than you‚Äôd expect‚Äô, and it‚Äôs been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it‚Äôs only fitting that we‚Äôd pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn‚Äôt be siloed from the rest of the organisation ‚Äì they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‚Äòchampion the customer‚Äô, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‚Äòsucceed as a team‚Äô, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‚Äòmake it happen‚Äô by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‚Äòbuild to scale‚Äô, creating lasting solutions that address today‚Äôs challenges and anticipate tomorrow‚Äôs needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices ‚Äîand quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it‚Äôs our company language so you‚Äôll be speaking lots of it if you join üíï
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone üòä
We‚Äôre on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That‚Äôs only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
