Title: Quant Research AI
Description:
Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with our GM Data and AI Lab teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions for various projects
Conduct independent research to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technology within the Markets 360 investment research domain
Contribute to the development of systematic and industrialized AI solutions to enhance investment strategies
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of AI technologies into our existing infrastructure
Stay updated on the latest AI advancements and industry trends to continuously improve our Markets 360 research efforts


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in a numeric subject with understanding of economics and markets (eg.: Economics with a speciality in Econometrics, Finance, Computer Science, Applied Maths, Engineering, Physics)
Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
Programming skills‚ÄØin Python‚ÄØand knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy,‚ÄØscikit-learn, pandas,‚ÄØKeras, TensorFlow,‚ÄØPyTorch)
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing AI solutions, with a focus on large language models and natural language processing
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to manage projects efficiently, including planning, execution, and monitoring
Understanding of the financial industry and investment research, including relevant regulations and compliance requirements


About The Team

Markets 360 is made up of around 100 economists, strategists and analysts across the Americas, Western Europe, CEEMEA and Asia Pacific, who work closely together to create cross-asset perspectives.

With a focus on value-added research and thought leadership, the aim is to publish clear, timely and thought-provoking pieces on topics ranging from financial and economic forecasts to in-depth analysis of particular assets, economies and themes.

The GM Data and AI Lab team is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

This role will be in Portugal, working alongside the AI Lab and the Markets 360 teams based across the globe.

About Global Markets

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶)

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

  • The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
  • The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
  • Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
  • The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled

Your Main Activities Are

  • Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
  • Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
  • Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
  • Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
  • Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
  • Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
  • Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
  • Up to 3 years of relevant experience
  • Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
  • Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
  • Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)

Title: OPC Reporting and Automation - Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:


Regulatory Practice: support any regulatory requirement with a sustainable framework, in line with the dedicated Governance, Control Plan & Risk Assessment
Conduct Practice: assess and challenge the effectiveness of the Conduct control set-up as well as ensure a full convergence between Conduct Risk Identification (CRI), Risk and Control Self-Assessment ‚Äì RCSA).
Operational Risk Practice: contribute to protect the business (P&L, reputation)


The three Practices are further supported by three transversal Streams ‚Äì Protection (Management and monitoring of incidents, remediation actions and recommendations), Prevention (Deploying RCSA and contribute to Operational risk computation) and Supervision (Validation process and Coordinating the internal control Governance and other Regulatory-based committees).

Your Main Activities Are


Support the team to produce regular reporting on the main operational risk indicators, and proactively suggest improvements on the reports;
Use different tools to collect and analyze data, as well as structuring queries and performing routine maintenance of reports;
Perform trend analysis comparison to previous weeks/months/quarters
Proactively suggest improvements on reports on a continuous basis and promote digital solutions
Ensure data input & quality check;
Support the execution of governance committees and presentations
Support the OPC team with Ad-Hoc requests (Statistics; Kpis; presentations; etc.)
Liaise & Interact with OPC teams worldwide


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor, Post-Graduation or Master Degree in Data Science; Management, Finance, Science, Maths;
Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, VBA, Power BI, (other languages would be a plus)
Analytical and quantitative skills, Precision, rigorousness;
Excellent organizational skills
Team spirit, ability to work with others;
Ability to communicate clearly in both oral and written form (English);
Experience in investment banking is an advantage.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Title: Global Insights Senior Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) will be home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP will offer rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe‚Äôs most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo ‚Äì Sete Rios, Av. Jos√© Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you‚Äôre part of something bigger, it‚Äôs because you are. At Amgen our shared mission‚Äîto serve patients‚Äîdrives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world‚Äôs leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together‚Äîresearching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It‚Äôs time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Commercial Analytics Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

The Global Commercial Insights team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Global Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving global commercial strategy. As a Global Insights Senior Associate, you will support development of global analytical tools and capabilities that enable Global Insights teams to leverage secondary data to derive insights and help accelerate business decisions to support products and pipeline assets across therapy areas. Additionally, you will assist in landscape research across therapy areas and disease states to support global commercial deliverables including brand planning, opportunity assessments, global performance tracking, etc.

The individual in this role must be willing to solve ambiguous problems by leveraging both technical and consultative skills sets

Responsibilities will include:


Design, implement, and optimize global analytical tools and frameworks that enable Global Insights teams to extract insights from secondary data, supporting data-driven decision-making.
Build secondary data analytics toolbox to train and guide the Global Insights teams to efficiently use secondary data for insights generation for several global commercial deliverables.
Build ETL processes (Extract, Transform, & Load) for several data sources, analyze patterns and trends, and develop data models to support business needs.
Design systems for data storage, processing, and integration while ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Design, build, and maintain interactive Tableau/Power BI reports & dashboards with AI-driven analytics, troubleshoot issues, and optimize performance.
Ensure clear documentation for reports, dashboards, caveats, and processes for long-term usability.
Explore new data sources, methodologies, and visualization techniques (including AI-based techniques and methodologies) to enhance insights generation and increase the impact of secondary analytics in decision-making influencing global commercial strategy across portfolio.
Utilize syndicated and real-world data sources (e.g., IQVIA, claims data, epidemiology data) to generate dashboards for key metrics across diseases.
Conduct landscape assessments across multiple therapy areas and disease states, identifying key market trends and unmet needs to support global commercial deliverables.
Set priorities, develop and manage multiple projects and timelines simultaneously.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Minimum 3 years of experience in Pharma/Biotech analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Master‚Äôs degree and 3 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 5 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
University Degree in data science, commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint knowledge


Preferred Requirements:


Familiarity with technologies and applications, and hands-on experience to analyze, synthesize, and integrate various secondary data
Knowledge in data, analytics, research, and/or dashboarding & reporting approach
Experience with commonly used biopharmaceutical industry secondary datasets and databases
A keen eye for design, with the ability to develop compelling Power BI and Tableau dashboards
Ability to write and execute SQL queries to extract and manipulate data
Skilled in tools like Tableau, Python, and PowerBI
Knowledge of AI and ability to integrate AI-based solutions in workflow / dashboard / tools / analytics
Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and draw meaningful conclusions
Ability to identify and resolve technical issues
Knowledge of modern cloud-based warehouse technologies such as Snowflake, Amazon Redshift is preferred
Ability to drive implementation to enhance methodologies and standard processes in secondary data analytics
Strong oral and written presentation skills, with ability to explain complex concepts verbally or visually via PowerPoint / Excel
Evident project management skills‚Äîable to manage multiple, simultaneous projects and data sources
Understanding of the Bio-Pharmaceutical and biotech industry trends and operations
Ability to work collaboratively in team-based environment


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing

  • You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
  • Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
  • Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
  • You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
  • Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
  • Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
  • You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation

What Makes You Great

  • You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
  • Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
  • In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
  • You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
  • Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
  • You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
  • Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
  • Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
  • You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
  • You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation

Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Description

Who is Defined.ai? Well, from a technical point of view, we leverage the power of a global crowd to provide some of the world‚Äôs biggest companies with the high-quality data they need to power their artificial intelligence. We‚Äôre instrumental to the progression and development of artificial intelligence and we couldn‚Äôt be prouder or more inspired to be involved in an industry that is changing the world.

From a personal point of view, we‚Äôre a group of big thinkers, high achievers and creative problem solvers. We bond over our shared love of software engineering, data science, and strong coffee. We like online gaming, running marathons, and team drinks. We celebrate authenticity and diversity and we‚Äôre invested in what we do. Our mission? World domination, obviously!

What will you do?

  • Design and implement scalable PySpark-based data pipelines to process (clean, validate, package and deliver) multimodal AI training datasets (e.g., text, audio, video, images, etc.);
  • Develop ETL pipelines to fuel the Operations areas with data for their analytical dashboards;
  • Set software engineering tools, platforms, and best practices while performing trade-off analysis to best match engineering, product, and project constraints and expectations;
  • Operate data pipelines to ingest data from multiple sources, and deliver it to different destinations.
  • Help the Product Manager and stakeholders in structuring, breaking down, and prioritizing the product roadmap into backlog work items;
  • Collaborate with other software engineering teams such as SREs and DevOps to achieve your team‚Äôs goals;
  • Work together with Software Engineering teams so as to integrate the Data Platform with other tools and platforms.

Who are we looking for?

Do you have the drive to work in an innovative and ambitious environment?

We‚Äôre looking for someone with a determined and proactive mindset, someone inspired and passionate to help us achieve our goals. Our successful candidate is a strong critical thinker, reliable and transparent, with an ability to learn and communicate. We are looking for someone special to contribute to our unique culture.

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science or similar background;
  • Experience in PySpark-based data pipelines and software quality best practices;
  • Worked with Azure services such as Synapse Analytics (mainly PySpark Jobs, Pipelines, and Notebooks), ADLS, Power BI, DevOps, and SQL and NoSQL databases;
  • Solid understanding of data-related architectures, concepts, technologies, and processes (e.g., Medallion, Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, ETL, etc.);
  • Comfortable with evaluating and applying software design and architectural patterns/principles;
  • Knowledge of RESTful APIs based on FastAPI, from the provider as well as the consumer point of view;
  • Problem Solving skills;
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English.

Benefits

You spend a lot of your time at work, so it should be challenging, fun and interesting. At Defined.ai it will be all of those things and more. Here‚Äôs what we offer:

  • Flexible working schedule and hybrid model. We know comfort can boost creativity and performance, so you can manage your schedule and work both from one of our modern office spaces or home.
  • Excellent career development opportunities in a high growth company. With us, you can accomplish your career goals and follow a well-described career path with the support of your supervisor.
  • Culture of feedback and continuous improvement. AI is a fast-paced area, so we keep track of tech trends, and we always ask for feedback.
  • An international and diverse team. We have more than 30 nationalities at our 3 locations, and we provide language classes.
  • Continuous training opportunities. You can choose from many options: leveraging hand-on workshops, unlimited access to Udemy and formal development opportunities.
  • We love to have fun together. We joke a lot, and we can't imagine work without fun activities ‚Äì we already surfed, raced carts and played soccer together.

About Us

Defined.ai offers a platform with multiple data delivery options that leverages machine learning technology and human intelligence to deliver quality-guaranteed training data for AI systems. The platform offers self-service and fully customizable solutions that deliver high-quality project-specific training data, enabling AI products reach market quicker. It is this business model that has allowed Defined.ai to raise a total of $63.6M in funding over 4 rounds. Our value proposition is quality, privacy, speed and scale, covering more than 50 different languages. With strong expertise in speech and natural language processing technologies, we have been serving AI companies and Fortune 500 companies since day one. Defined.ai was founded in Seattle and has offices in Lisbon and Porto.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? üöÄüåç

At TEKEVER, we lead innovation in Europe as the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation.

üíª Digital | üõ°Ô∏è Defence | üîí Security | üõ∞Ô∏è Space

We operate across four strategic areas, combining artificial intelligence, systems engineering, data science, and aerospace technology to tackle global challenges ‚Äî from protecting people and critical infrastructure to exploring space.

We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that delivers real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. Our products and services support strategic and operational decisions in the most demanding environments ‚Äî whether at sea, on land, in space, or in cyberspace.

üåê Become part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary, and mission-driven team that is transforming maritime surveillance and redefining global safety standards.

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to empower critical decision-making.

If you're passionate about technology and eager to shape the future ‚Äî TEKEVER is the place for you. üëáüèªüéØ

Mission

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities


Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.


Profile And Requirements


Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
Experience with data modeling and schema design.
Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Language Requirements: Advanced proficiency in Portuguese and English, with proven fluency at the C2 level in both languages.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

What We Have To Offer You


An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
Flexible work arrangements;
Professional development opportunities;
Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.


Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Engineer to join our growing data team. In this role, you will be instrumental in building, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure, with a strong emphasis on DataOps principles. You will work closely with data analysts, and other engineers to ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of our data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Translate the business requirements into technical specifications, in cooperation with the data product owner.
Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines using Airflow.
Utilize dbt for data transformation and modeling, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Employ Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC), automating the provisioning and management of our data infrastructure.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for data engineering workflows.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks.
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Contribute to the development of data engineering best practices and standards.
Manage and maintain data repositories using Git.
Automate data-related tasks to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Cooperate with the support teams and provide L3 support to comply with predefined SLA‚Äôs


Key Qualifications


University degree in computer science, engineering, or comparable field.
3-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies.
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) data services (e.g., BigQuery, Cloud Storage)
Knowledge of dbt and version management tools (e.g. Git).
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform.
Experience with workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience working with SAP platforms as data sources (e.g., SAP ECC, SAP S/4HANA, SAP BW, SAP Datasphere).
Knowledge of SAP data structures and extraction methods.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g. Looker).
Scrum methodology.

Title: Data Analyst Team Leader - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As the RISK Reporting Team Leader, you will oversee the Lisbon team responsible for producing BCEF‚Äôs RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in collaboration with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also be responsible for producing credit risk reporting and indicators to meet increasing regulatory requirements and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank‚Äôs credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines ‚Äì LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


Ensure the smooth execution and proper planning of the team‚Äôs tasks, ensuring deadlines are met
Supervise and contribute to the production of capital controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall)
Supervise and contribute to the creation of dashboards and presentation explaining RWA amounts and variations
Supervise and contribute to the production of credit risk indicators and regulatory reporting (especially for recharges or new securitization vehicles)
Analyze and explain key metrics, trends, and areas for analysis from both business and risk perspectives
Be proactive in adapting and transforming reports and analyses to meet requests and evolving needs
Improve the permanent control framework (especially for run capital) to deliver timely, reliable, and consistent analysis and ensure that procedures are followed
Ensure effective cooperation between the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Lisbon and Paris and be the key contact for the Paris teams, providing support when needed
Facilitate the development and knowledge enhancement of team members


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Business Management or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics / Information Technology or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Python
SQL
Power BI
Ability to share/pass on knowledge
Active listening
Ability to manage a project
Ability to develop others and improve their skills

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst, for a project based in Lisbon.




Responsabilities:

Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing, and loading
Responsible for code and query optimization
Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost
Data Ingestion
Data processing
Data Quality
Support




Requirements:

Advanced Python (Mandatory)
Advanced SQL skills and relational database management (Oracle is Mandatory, SQL server is desirable, PostgreSQL is desirable )
PySpark (Mandatory)
Experience with Data Warehouses
Apache Airflow (Desirable experience in pipeline development)
Agile methodologies (Scrum)
Git (Is a plus)
Experience with Parquet file format (Is a plus)
Experience in creating APIs in Python (Is a plus)
Fluent in English (written and oral)




#letsgrowtogether üöÄ




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PrimeIT is a leading company with over 17 years of experience in providing IT, Telecommunications, and Engineering technology services. Specializing in Team Extension, Managed Services, Custom Software, and Nearshore, we currently have a team of over 2,350 professionals working on national and international projects across various technologies.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for this project!




What are we looking for?

Strong knowledge of Power BI, including Power Query, M, and DAX.
Solid SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience integrating data from APIs, Excel, CSV files, and databases.
Knowledge of SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) is a plus for future involvement in ETL projects.




Responsibilities:

Create dashboards in Power BI according to client requirements.
Analyze data to ensure KPIs and metrics are aligned with business objectives.
Implement and support dashboards, adjusting or adding information as needed.
Manage ETL processes, ensuring proper data preparation and transformation for reporting.




What do we offer?

Integration into an international company with a presence in over 50 cities worldwide.
Continuous training in the latest and most innovative technologies ‚Äì Prime Academy.
Career development and support.

üì© Send us your CV and join the Prime team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise

With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîéWe are looking for a Data Analyst




MAIN TASKS:




Create data pipelines in Airflow for data extraction, processing, and loading
Optimize code and queries for performance and efficiency
Generate insights and identify trends, anomalies, or opportunities to improve user experience
Deliver data in useful and appealing formats to end users
Understand business changes and requirement needs, and assess their impact and cost
Perform data ingestion from various sources
Process and transform data for analysis and reporting
Ensure data quality and consistency across systems
Provide support for data-related issues and system reliability




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Proficient in Python programming (mandatory)
Strong expertise in SQL and relational databases, with mandatory experience in Oracle; familiarity with SQL Server and PostgreSQL is desirable
Hands-on experience with PySpark (mandatory)
Familiarity with Git version control is considered a plus
Experience developing pipelines using Apache Airflow is desirable
Comfortable working within Agile environments, particularly with SCRUM methodology
Fluent in English




üìçHybrid Model at the Lisbon office




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? üîç

If your answer is yes, it‚Äôs your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! üëÄ




üßê WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR IN YOU?

Experience in Data Domain, Data Dictionary, Data Governance.
Expertise (E2 at least) in SQL and preparing medium to high complexity queries. Good to have - exposure to RDBMS, NoSQL, cloud Databases - Redshift/Snowflake as well as flat files - as per real world scenarios.
Data sampling, Data quality analysis, Data Modelling.
Responsible for Data mapping deliverables (Source-to-target mappings) as well as Data dictionary providing a detailed understanding of new product builds.
Adept in analytical abilities to determine root cause for data issues with quick turnaround.
Awareness/Understanding of GDPR and Data encryption best practices and norms followed as per global IT standards.
Familiarity with Aviation domain - is an added advantage. Alternatively quick learner to adapt to Airlines Operations domain terms and terminologies - considering the client landscape.
Provide playback of role specific deliverables to Build teams to provide in depth end to end Data flow understanding for product.
Should have a good balance of business, data and moderate technical understanding - to enable effective stakeholder management.




üìÖ WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Lisbon + hybrid work
Work Schedule: 9AM to 6PM




ü§ù WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract üìã
Pay and benefits üí∏ - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan + Health Insurance).
Opportunity knocks üëçüèª - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow üìö - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy üë´ - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you‚Äôll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally üåè - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
And so on üéâ - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




üí° WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968, being part of the Tata Group.

With a presence in 55 countries and over 600,000 employees, TCS is recognized as the #1 Employer in Europe by the Top Employers Institute ü•á

In our portfolio of services, we have information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS üéØ

We stand out for our experience, reliability, passion, confidence, creativity and skills üíØ

Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!


At InnoTech, it‚Äôs all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.


For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!


Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.


Your Mission Will Be:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders from different sectors to identify and understand their specific analytical needs and challenges;
  • Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for improvement and customization;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights;
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need:

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in data analysis;
  • Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have:

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
  • Experience in query languages such as SQL;
  • Familiarity with business intelligence principles and data management practices.


With Us You Can Be a:

  • TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
  • TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
  • InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
  • InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Business Data Analyst ‚Äì Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies




Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.




About the Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.




As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll

Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.




What You Bring

Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.




What We Bring to the Deal

Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
