HTML:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies


Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.


About the Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.


As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll

  • Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
  • Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
  • Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
  • Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring

  • Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
  • Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
  • Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
  • Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
  • Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
  • Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring to the Deal

  • Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
  • Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
  • Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
  • Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let‚Äôs create something transformative together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

netum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023

Job Description

The purpose of this role is to provide data analysis and reporting tools for the VERDI team or assimilate (Compliance, top management, IG, Business) on an ad hoc and a regular basis using a variety of tools and programming skills.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities


Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing, and loading
Responsible for code and query optimization
Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost
Data Ingestion
Data processing
Data Quality
Support


Qualifications

Technical skills:


Advanced Python
Advanced SQL skills and relational database management (Oracle is Mandatory, SQL server is desirable, PostgreSQL is desirable )
PySpark
Git - (is a plus)
Experience with Data Warehouses
Experience with Parquet file format is a plus
Experience in creating APIs in Python is a plus
Apache Airflow - Experience in pipeline development is desirable
Agile methodologies (At least SCRUM)


Language Skills


Fluent in English (Mandatory)


Soft Skills


Good communication skills
Strong analytical abilities, able to have the right synthesis and all possible details at same time
Team spirit
Client Focus
Adaptability skills

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Semasio, a Samba TV company, is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands trust our industry-leading advertising solutions to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. Our team is located globally in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany, and Denmark.




We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community. Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks your curiosity, then read on!




Are you passionate about turning data into insights? Do you have a keen eye for detail and a drive to optimize business performance? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for a Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team in

Porto. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and efficiency of our data models and reports. Your contributions will directly impact strategic decision-making, providing stakeholders with critical insights to drive the company forward.




What You‚Äôll Do:
Maintain and update our BI data model, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Own specific monthly reports and updates, ensuring timely and precise delivery.
Work closely with different teams to understand reporting needs and enhance data quality.
Identify opportunities to improve data structures and reporting processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data inconsistencies or anomalies.
Support the development of new dashboards and analytics solutions.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:
Strong attention to detail‚Äînothing slips past you!
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for optimizing data processes.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Basic understanding of data modeling concepts and database structures.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive attitude, always looking for ways to improve and streamline reporting.
A degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus.




Why Join Us?
Be part of a data-driven company that values innovation and continuous learning.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions matter.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the exciting field of Business Intelligence.









Samba TV is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.¬†¬†We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.




Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, under the applicable law.¬†For further details, please see Samba's¬†Applicant Privacy Policy.¬†For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Data Analyst - Junior/Senior Level
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîé We are looking for a Data Analyst - Junior and Senior Level




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze large volumes of data to help with business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports in Power BI to show results clearly.
Process, clean and transform data with Python, PySpark or Scala, especially in Big Data environments.
Building data pipelines (ETL) and preparing datasets for analysis.
Collaboration with technical and business teams to ensure data quality and consistency.
Supporting continuous improvement and data governance initiatives.
Automate processes to save time and avoid errors.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Experience in Power BI (modeling, DAX, visualizations).
Python skills applied to data analysis.
Knowledge of PySpark / Spark / Scala (valued in Big Data environments).
Solid knowledge of SQL.
Notions of data quality and governance.
Good communication skills (technical and non-technical).
Analytical mind and problem-solving orientation.
Proactivity and a sense of responsibility.
Proficiency in English (minimum B2).




üìçHybrid Role in Porto.




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

Youe role in our team




‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.

‚Ä¢ Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

‚Ä¢ Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.

‚Ä¢ Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.

‚Ä¢ Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

‚Ä¢ Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

Your profile:




‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Your benefits

We offer you:

‚Ä¢ Possibility of Working from Home ‚Äì we care about results not locations;

‚Ä¢ Training Budget for each employee ‚Äì we care about the growth of our people;

‚Ä¢ Private Health Insurance ‚Äì we care about health on and off working hours;

‚Ä¢ 3 Additional Vacation Days ‚Äì we care about free time;

‚Ä¢ Cooking, sports or book club ‚Äì we care about spending time with our folks;

‚Ä¢ Fresh fruits ‚Äì we care about your daily dose of vitamins;

‚Ä¢ Fresh coffee, tea or water ‚Äì we care about boosting your day.

‚Ä¢ A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;




An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.




Requirements:

Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
Database Management (SQL)
Methodologies (Agile)
Office Pack (MS Excel)
Power BI / Tableau
English required, both spoken and written.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com or with reference ‚ÄúDataAnalyst‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support the company‚Äôs internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.


üí° What We're Looking For


Strong knowledge in Data processing, Data quality, and Data management
Proven experience in IT Development and database administration (SQL)
Familiarity with Agile methodologies to drive efficiency
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Pack, particularly Excel
Hands-on experience with Power BI / Tableau for data visualization
Fluency in English and French


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DA/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project based in Porto (2x/Week).




Requirements:

Minimum of 3 years experience as a Data Analyst.
Database management experience (SQL Sever).
Experience with Agile methodologies.
Experience with PowerBI/Tableau.
Fluency in English is mandatory.




Responsibilities:

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference CN/DAP.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Being part of the The Data Quality Team, the Data Analyst will closely collaborate with stakeholders, system owners and data consumers, being responsible to: provide data quality monitoring through indicators and support remediation processes; Provide to all stakeholders a clear visibility of data-related controls and its implementation. The main responsibilities are to Control the consistency of data input by the customers and different entities; Perform and contribute to data remediations (local & central); Identify data quality issues and resolution to relevant business users ; Work in close collaboration with all business data consumers to take the right decisions on functional evolution and manage impacts on data usage; Propose and/or contribute to all initiatives allowing the improvement of the data and its quality; Organize and run tests of enhancements linked to data quality; Monitor data sourcing, perform analysis of rejected data, inform stakeholders and customers.

Main Tasks


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within the company.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
Database Management (SQL)
Methodologies (Agile)
Office Pack (MS Excel)
Power BI / Tableau


Language Skills


English


Soft Skills


IT - Business/IT relationship
Analytical Ability
Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

Strong ability to collect, process, and analyze large datasets to drive business insights and decision-making.
Proficient in SQL.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau for creating interactive dashboards and visualizations to communicate complex data insights effectively.
Fluency in English and French.


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
M/F










CHALLENGE:




As a Data Analyst, you will play a central role in supporting strategic planning and improving business analysis, predicting outcomes, and understanding complex data relationships.




Work closely with business users to understand the questions they want to answer with data, propose and design possible solutions, and work together with other teams to implement those solutions.







MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:




Define, execute data analysis to make recommendations to support decision making
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations
Develop and automate reports, and dashboards to provide insights at scale to define business priorities, and to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership
Verify, validate data accuracy and reports to provide a high quality of standards
Optimize Internal business processes to increase operational efficiency across all platforms
Contribute to building a strong data-driven culture.







PROFILE:




Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or equivalent fields of study
A professional with +3 years of experience with data analytics
Interest and experience in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics, and program evaluation
Experienced in leveraging data and analytics to solve real-world problems and create new solutions. This requires a strong understanding of business processes and data flows.
Experience with Excel, Power BI and SQL
Familiarity in Python to the extent of delivering the same analysis you could do in SQL and a BI tool, and knowledge of Algorithms in Retail is a nice-to-have
An excellent communicator with presentation skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Critical thinking
Problem-solving aptitude.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar‚Äôs BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company‚Äôs business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team‚Äôs existing BI assets.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team‚Äôs efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team‚Äôs efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst Mid
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

You Will Be Responsible For



Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.
Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.
Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.



Your Profile



Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.
Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.
Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.
Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.



Benefits + Application

We Offer You



Possibility of Working from Home ‚Äì we care about results not locations;
Training Budget for each employee ‚Äì we care about the growth of our people;
Private Health Insurance ‚Äì we care about health on and off working hours;
3 Additional Vacation Days ‚Äì we care about free time;
Cooking, sports or book club ‚Äì we care about spending time with our folks;
Fresh fruits ‚Äì we care about your daily dose of vitamins;
Fresh coffee, tea or water ‚Äì we care about boosting your day.
A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;



An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work on a project focused on the evolution of third-party data ecosystems would aim to streamline the integration of new data and technologies such as data virtualization, APIs, etc., enhancing the accessibility and real-time availability of data across systems.

They would ensure high data quality and consistency across various REFERENTIALS data sources and reducing discrepancies in reporting and closing figures by performing a deep analysis on the existing data and sources and transform the processes and technologies used, including the existing REFERENTIALS. The goal is to streamline workflows, improving time to market and enabling faster and more accurate insights for better decision-making.

Main Tasks


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
Database Management (SQL)
Methodologies (Agile)
Office Pack (MS Excel)
Power BI / Tableau


Language Skills


English - 3 - Expert


Soft Skills


IT - Business/IT relationship
Analytical Ability
Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Attention to detail / rigor


Additional


University degree, or equivalent by experience, in Information Technology and/or Computer Science, Information Management, or other related fields.


Knowledge in referential data is a plus
Show more

The Data Analyst will work on a project focused on the evolution of third-party data ecosystems would aim to streamline the integration of new data and technologies such as data virtualization, APIs, etc., enhancing the accessibility and real-time availability of data across systems.

They would ensure high data quality and consistency across various REFERENTIALS data sources and reducing discrepancies in reporting and closing figures by performing a deep analysis on the existing data and sources and transform the processes and technologies used, including the existing REFERENTIALS. The goal is to streamline workflows, improving time to market and enabling faster and more accurate insights for better decision-making.

Main Tasks

  • Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
  • Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
  • Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
  • Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.

Qualifications

Technical Skills:

  • Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
  • Database Management (SQL)
  • Methodologies (Agile)
  • Office Pack (MS Excel)
  • Power BI / Tableau

Language Skills

  • English - 3 - Expert

Soft Skills

  • IT - Business/IT relationship
  • Analytical Ability
  • Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics
  • Ability to understand, explain and support change
  • Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
  • Attention to detail / rigor

Additional

  • University degree, or equivalent by experience, in Information Technology and/or Computer Science, Information Management, or other related fields.

Knowledge in referential data is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support the company‚Äôs internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within the company.


üí° What We're Looking For


Strong ability to collect, process, and analyze large datasets to drive business insights and decision-making.
Proficient in SQL.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau for creating interactive dashboards and visualizations to communicate complex data insights effectively.
Fluency in English and French.


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject ‚ÄúDA/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Business/Data Analyst (Finance)
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking for a Business/Data Analyst to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution‚Äôs globally.


As a Business Analyst you will work in a Agile environment and you must be able to respond quickly and work on ad hoc requests from within and across teams regarding evolutionary maintenance tasks and production support.


What you will do:

  • Gather and analyze Business Requirements for new and ongoing projects;
  • Manage and respond to support requests;
  • Write specifications and user stories according to project requirements;
  • Define the plan for implementation of requests/projects;
  • Track and report project progress.


What you are like:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst;
  • Solid knowledge in financial products and market data;
  • Proven experience in IT Business Analysis or Analytics;
  • Knowledge in mathematics and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Python and R are a plus, but not mandatory)
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies;
  • Knowledge of project management tools such as Jira and Confluence;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Ability to work in a team;
  • Good level of English ‚Äì minimum B2 (mandatory);


Why join us

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Possibility of working remotely
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • ‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • +4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Strong experience with Alteryx;
  • Experience with Alteryx Server and Alteryx Design;
  • Good Knowledge of SQL and PowerBI;
  • Knowledge in Agile methodologies and tools;
  • Fluent in English


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid.
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at daniela.lesco@aubay.pt.


Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;

Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for one year period).

The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.

For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL‚Äôs headquarters in Avenida Duque D`√Åvila, n¬∫46 em Lisboa or use the DPO‚Äôs e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority ‚Äì www.cnpd.pt.

(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.).

Title: Data Science Analyst (Fashion)
Description:
Who We Are




We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS‚Äô eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What you will do




Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.




What you‚Äôll bring




1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)




Nice to have:




Experience in retail, fashion, or e-commerce industries.
Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Finance Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Analyse and interpret financial data focusing on IFRS13.
Developing analytical models for Position, PnL and Mark to Market, valuation etc.
Build and maintain financial data transformation & reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
Maintain finance master data governance model. ¬∑ Ensure data accuracy and support automation of recurring reporting tasks.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. ¬∑ 1‚Äì3 years of experience in financial or data analysis.
Working knowledge of IFRS 13 and financial instrument valuation. ¬∑ Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
Advanced Excel (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query).
SQL for querying and managing financial datasets. ¬∑ Basic knowledge of AI models related to Finance is a Plus.
Power BI or Qlik sense or Open source (Apache Superset..) for data visualization and reporting.
Familiarity with financial systems or market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) is a plus
Proficiency in English.

HTML:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

  • DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;


  • DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;


  • DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for an Finance Data Analyst!


Responsibilities:

  • Analyse and interpret financial data focusing on IFRS13.
  • Developing analytical models for Position, PnL and Mark to Market, valuation etc.
  • Build and maintain financial data transformation & reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
  • Maintain finance master data governance model. ¬∑ Ensure data accuracy and support automation of recurring reporting tasks.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. ¬∑ 1‚Äì3 years of experience in financial or data analysis.
  • Working knowledge of IFRS 13 and financial instrument valuation. ¬∑ Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
  • Advanced Excel (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query).
  • SQL for querying and managing financial datasets. ¬∑ Basic knowledge of AI models related to Finance is a Plus.
  • Power BI or Qlik sense or Open source (Apache Superset..) for data visualization and reporting.
  • Familiarity with financial systems or market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) is a plus
  • Proficiency in English.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/FinanceDataAnalyst‚Äù.

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
We like to solve problems, and we can‚Äôt go a day without looking for innovative solutions. Ytech is a technological start-up focused on IT and Telecommunications that operates in two main areas: national project development and remote international projects.




üöÄ Ready to join us, Power BI Analyst?




Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain effective and user-friendly Power BI dashboards and reports.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, seasonality, and data behaviors.
Clearly communicate analytical findings and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Work independently with a proactive and problem-solving attitude.
Be available to travel internationally for short periods when required.




Main Technical Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
4+ years of hands-on experience with Power BI.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent communication skills to present data-driven insights.
Good command of English (minimum B2 level ‚Äì mandatory).
Fast learner with autonomy and initiative.




Nice to Have / Plus

Experience working alongside Engineering teams on ETL pipelines.
Programming knowledge in Python or R.
Solid understanding of SQL and VBA.
Experience with SSAS, SSIS, and Azure.
Previous exposure to the financial sector.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban).
Knowledge of French is a plus.




What makes us different

Our vision is to innovate and reinvent through technological services, promoting the success of our partners.
Our mission is to connect clients with highly specialized professionals and drive business forward.
Our culture is centred on people and their well-being, which allows us to attract and retain the best talent.







Join the Ytech team! Send your CV to ihilario@ytech.io

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 under the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specialized in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.

We are now looking for a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

*For this position you need to have residency in Portugal.

Are you the one?

Between 3-6 years of experience in Data Analytics and/or similar roles.
Data Knowledge: Data processing, quality, and IT development.
Database Management: Strong SQL proficiency.
Methodologies: Agile.
Office Pack: Advanced MS Excel.
Data Visualization: Power BI / Tableau.
English (C1/C2) is mandatory, and French is a plus.
Business/IT Relationship Management.
Strong Analytical Ability.
Collaboration and Teamwork.
Attention to Detail & Rigor.




We believe we are the ones too, by:

Providing a Multidisciplinary Team;
Giving a home office kit, with everything you need to perform remotely;
Ensuring a career plan alongside with professional growth;
Providing you with a custom training plan;
Helping you reach happiness.

Oh‚Ä¶ and by the way, we also have:

Several challenging complex projects;
Stimulating teams and leaders;
World-class Clients and Partners.

If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV and reach the closest side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics. At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîé We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx)




MAIN TASKS:




Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and solve business problems.
Translate business requirements into Alteryx workflows, collaborating with local and remote IT teams to process and make data available to users.
Develop workflows according to IT software development governance rules.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary to deliver data projects.
Maintain and evolve assets created during the projects.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Experience: 4+ years in data preparation and data reconciliation.

Technical Skills:

Strong experience with Alteryx (2+ years).
Proficient in SQL.
Experience with VBA.
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a similar field.

Communication & Soft Skills:

Good communication skills.
Proactive and able to work autonomously.
Strong interest in learning, improving processes, and helping others.
Ability to collaborate effectively within a team and across locations.
Languages: Proficient in English.
Nice to have: Power BI experience, experience in the financial industry, knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban), and French language skills.




üìçHybrid Role in Porto!




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Market Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis is a French multinational financial services firm specialized in asset & wealth management, corporate & investment banking, insurance and payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, the second-largest banking group in France through its two retail banking networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d‚ÄôEpargne, Natixis counts nearly 16,000 employees across 38 countries.

As Natixis Innovation Hub, Natixis in Portugal mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank‚Äôs business, operations and work culture, being a key driver of the company‚Äôs culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Job Description

Market Risk Department supervises all Market Risk and P&L indicators of Natixis Global Markets activities.

Market data Hub team mandate is centered around the quantitative daily control challenge, certifies and feeds FO systems with end of day Market Data across several asset classes (equity, rates, and FX). This process is done using an in-house dedicated application called MDM (Market Data Manager) which is used by the different international platforms (Paris, HK and NY).

Besides the daily production the analyst will be responsible to perform daily and monthly tasks related to market data controls on different asset classes (equity, rates, and FX) and update on the market data framework.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The analyst will intervene on risk factors and market data across FX, equity and Rates asset classes and will actively:


Help to produce presentations of results for internal committees with the senior management
Develop control and certification capacity by setting up and running proper quantitative and qualitative challenges to the current algorithm used when assessing market data external providers
Support Market data hub team in creating daily certifications tasks
Help replying to clients needs (CCA, Front office, Econometrics, MRM, etc) on daily basis
Maintain an efficient and clean market data framework


Analyst will work in close collaboration with multiples departments from Front Offices / FO Quants, to various market risk teams and other risk quantitative methodologies teams.

Qualifications


Advanced degree in computer science, data science or finance is a must
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and Java, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization libraries
Knowledge of interest rate, credit, fx, equity and commodity products and risk factors
+5 years Experience working in the financial services industry or a related field is a plus
Strong desire to learn and eager to make a meaningful impact in a dynamic and innovative environment
Programming skills, python, SQL, java
Proficient in data APIs
Knowledge on Natixis valuation systems: Summit, Polypaths, Sophis, Murex, among others is a plus
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Knowledge in financial products and financial market is required
English speaker is mandatory


We will only consider English Cv's.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.
