Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description:

BrandDelta empowers companies around the world to transform the way their Brands can learn and win. Our Brand Intelligence platform is built to enable our clients to understand how consumers perceive their brands faster, deeper and in a more actionable manner with measurable links. We are already optimizing ¬£550m of marketing investment to help Brands Grow across 3 continents. BrandDelta has ambitious plans for growth, with Porto marked as the centre for our team growth and development. Our Founders have a history building globally awarded AI businesses (e.g. achieving a top-10 Gartner rating for AI-led insight in 2020 and 2021) and investing heavily back into the Team & the Business.




Role Description:

As an Insights Analyst,¬†you will play pivotal role in turning our unique data into compelling insights & stories to attract & engage with Marketing, Brand, and Leadership teams in Global Consumer & D2C organizations. We are developing and integrating a corpus of cross-channel digital signals from social, search, web, reviews and offline survey datasets to uncover insights, to help our clients & new prospects succeed in the 21st Century marketing.




In this role, you will be responsible for collaborating with our Data & AI team here in Porto in undertaking strategic and ongoing research to scale our platform & Develop Insights from the Product Category you will be working on. You will typically take ownership of a number categories & clients, whilst identifying compelling & topical insights.

You will play client facing and report to our Insights team + Leadership in order to ensure a successful link between the relationship and insights




Requirements

Undergraduate or higher degree in Business, Economics, Social Sciences, from a reputable University with a strong academic performance
Autonomous and willing to take the ownership on their own projects
Proven experience in conducting research & understanding various research methodologies
Data driven & literate (data analysis, vlookups, correlational analysis, pivots etc.)
Strong storytelling & presentation skills
A track record of writing plans and designing research
Culturally plugged in and literate in modern media from a user & industry perspective
Sharp thinker and crisp communicator ‚Äì able to synthesize complex problems to senior leaders
Ability to synthesize large amounts of information - and translate into an easily understood story
This is a client facing role and candidates must be comfortable in this environment




Preferred Skills/Experience:

Experience in Consumer / Marketing insights with the ability to apply knowledge of and passion for digital, social, mobile media, and other new platforms to provide insight and evaluation that helps clients build stronger consumer connections.
Pricing, Promotions, Marketing Insight are a huge plus
Consumer Insights background in Marketing research outfit such as Kantar, IPSOS, or similar is also preferred.
Ability to explain findings and recommendations to a broad business audience, both internal and external
Educated on a variety of analytical methods, shapes thinking and influences decisions
Effectively complete tasks to achieve both short- and long-term goals within a team




What we offer:

Career Acceleration - Fast growth with many opportunities both in the AI-led software and business domains, with board-level clients.
Health Insurance
Flexible Work Hours - adjust your schedule to your needs
Work Setup - Hybrid ‚Äì Work from home but also collaborate weekly with the team
Hardware and software for remote setup
Autonomy and Ownership Culture
Continuous feedback culture
Innovation Mindset

You will play client facing and report to our Insights team + Leadership in order to ensure a successful link between the relationship and insights


Requirements

  • Undergraduate or higher degree in Business, Economics, Social Sciences, from a reputable University with a strong academic performance
  • Autonomous and willing to take the ownership on their own projects
  • Proven experience in conducting research & understanding various research methodologies
  • Data driven & literate (data analysis, vlookups, correlational analysis, pivots etc.)
  • Strong storytelling & presentation skills
  • A track record of writing plans and designing research
  • Culturally plugged in and literate in modern media from a user & industry perspective
  • Sharp thinker and crisp communicator ‚Äì able to synthesize complex problems to senior leaders
  • Ability to synthesize large amounts of information - and translate into an easily understood story
  • This is a client facing role and candidates must be comfortable in this environment


Preferred Skills/Experience:

  • Experience in Consumer / Marketing insights with the ability to apply knowledge of and passion for digital, social, mobile media, and other new platforms to provide insight and evaluation that helps clients build stronger consumer connections.
  • Pricing, Promotions, Marketing Insight are a huge plus
  • Consumer Insights background in Marketing research outfit such as Kantar, IPSOS, or similar is also preferred.
  • Ability to explain findings and recommendations to a broad business audience, both internal and external
  • Educated on a variety of analytical methods, shapes thinking and influences decisions
  • Effectively complete tasks to achieve both short- and long-term goals within a team


What we offer:

  • Career Acceleration - Fast growth with many opportunities both in the AI-led software and business domains, with board-level clients.
  • Health Insurance
  • Flexible Work Hours - adjust your schedule to your needs
  • Work Setup - Hybrid ‚Äì Work from home but also collaborate weekly with the team
  • Hardware and software for remote setup
  • Autonomy and Ownership Culture
  • Continuous feedback culture
  • Innovation Mindset

Title: Sustainability Analyst (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you passionate about sustainability, forward-thinking reporting, and shaping the future of corporate responsibility in a dynamic, international company? Then, this is the perfect opportunity for you! Join us as a Sustainability Analyst and contribute to Infineon‚Äôs global initiatives that make a difference.

Job Description

As a Sustainability Analyst, you will support key sustainability reporting and compliance efforts in a dynamic and international environment. You will help drive transparency, align with regulatory standards, and contribute to impactful initiatives across the organization.

In your new role, you will:


Assist in conducting the Double Material Assessment
Actively contribute to the preparation of non-financial reporting and collaborate on the development and implementation of concepts to meet future reporting requirements
Provide support for the overall reporting process and documentation
Conduct benchmarking activities and perform analyses
Coordinate effectively with internal interface partners
Coordinate legislative matters within the relevant field of activity
Participate in projects with a primary focus on non-financial reporting and related topics
Contribute to the EU Taxonomy assessment and classification by analyzing legal requirements and regulatory changes
Support global projects across the entire field of activity


Your Profile

You bring a sharp analytical mindset along with strong communication skills. You are solution-oriented, thrive in fast-paced environments, and enjoy working across cultures and departments to drive impactful results.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:


A degree in Sustainability, Natural Sciences or Economics, Business Law, or a similar field of studies
At least 2 years of professional experience in the field of sustainability or non-financial reporting in a company or auditing firm, preferably in an international and multicultural environment
Strong MS Office knowledge, especially Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Good analytical skills, strong communication, teamwork mindset, and highly solution-oriented approach
Fluency in English ‚Äì proficiency in German would be an advantage


Please send us your CV in English.

Contact:

Carla Almeida, LinkedIn

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome at Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! -


Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Data Service - Dataviz (SCD)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Service ‚Äì Dataviz for an international project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Get Knowledge over data visualization products, its features and several use cases.
Supervise and maintain Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Support users, manage and administrate Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Maintain operational readiness Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications and their infrastructure ensuring technologic follow up roadmap (upgrade, security, availability, performance, volumes, solving problem,‚Ä¶)
Contribute to the RUN tasks to maintain the Data Visualization products, and, above all, have a critical point of view to propose/implement the improvements needed to simplify/make the tasks more reliable
Get and keep informed about strategic plan of the Data Visualization products to define and lead actions to adapt the applications (Qlik Sense, BO, PowerBI)
Give advices and support to the IT developers and business lines users to build their projects and reports into Qlik Sense application
Contribute to migration project of BO dashboards to Qlik Sense or PowerBI
Contribute to implement PowerBI application and to define and deploy the service offering managed by the squad
Actively participate in projects by helping others squad members or business line users, managing, and doing building phases of dataviz
Write user guide and application support documentation
Contribute to all agile rituals


üí° WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Qlik Sense (expert including admistration)
Power BI (master, advanced administrator)
Relational data bases (Oracle, Exadata, PostGre, SQL,‚Ä¶) (master)
Fluency in French (B2) and English (B2)
SAP Business Objects (at least 1 significant experience or open-minded to learn) (nive to have)
Toolchain CI/CD (principle, tools, automated test...) (nive to have)
Security rules and protocols (nive to have)
Data source and open flows (nive to have)
Cloud Environment (pod, docker, kubernetes) (nive to have)
AI e Machine Learning OPS (is nice to have to know the basics)


‚≠ê WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DSD/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Show more

  • 2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.


WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
  • Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
  • Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
  • Support for your ongoing growth & development
  • Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
  • A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days


We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Experis Portugal is recruiting for one of our bigger clients, that is the leader in the banking sector in Europe, with presence in more than 60 countries. This job opportunity has a permanent contract directly with our client.




Responsibilities:




Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Operations Analyst
Description:
As a global leader in facilities services we connect people and places to make the world work better. Whether directly or indirectly, you‚Äôll play a vital role in supporting our placemakers in delivering exceptional workplace experiences for our customers. Together, we make space for people and businesses to thrive.

Want to know how a facility management company is powered by technology?

At ISS Tech Team we are investing in innovative and integrated technological solutions for the facility management industry with a tech team headquarted in Copenhagen, Warsaw and Porto. Our Porto hub is the first space dedicated specifically to software development and acts as a powerhouse where our employees test and implement products for over 40,000 clients and 350,000 placemakers around the world.

Job Role as Data Operations Analyst:

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Operations Analyst/ Data Loader who is eager to develop into a Data Operations Specialist. This role is ideal for someone passionate about data management and looking to grow their career in data operations.

Location: Porto, Portugal or Warsaw, Poland

Work type: Hybrid

What will you do:

Data Loading and Management:


Import and export data between various systems.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy during the loading process.
Maintain documentation of data loading procedures.



Data Quality and Troubleshooting:


Identify and resolve data loading issues.
Implement data quality control processes to ensure data accuracy.



Collaboration and Support:


Work closely with Integration, RPA and data teams to optimise data workflows.
Assist in the development and implementation of data governance policies.



Professional Development:


Participate in training and development programs to enhance skills in data operations.
Work towards understanding and managing data pipelines and workflow.



Who you‚Äôll work with:


Collaboration with all internal and external IT & business stakeholders both, at regional and country-level but also at global scale
Supporting operations performance in delivering best-in-class customer service
Co-ordinating and aligning across functional teams to ensure solution & data set up, configured and working as required.



What makes you fit:


Proficiency in data management tools and software.
Basic understanding of database structures and SQL.
Familiarity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Good problem-solving abilities.
Eagerness to learn and develop skills in data operations.
Ability to adapt to new technologies and processes.
Ability to work collaboratively with different teams.
Strong communication skills in English.



Nice to have skills:


Experience with data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python).
Basic knowledge of data governance and compliance standards.
Previous experience in a data-related role is a plus.



Why ISS:

At ISS, we are more than just a service provider of cleaning, food, workplace and technical services, we are a partner in our customers‚Äô success. By creating exceptional service moments and transforming workplaces into spaces where employees feel valued, engaged and productive, we enhance productivity and help our customers to attract talent and grow their businesses. This begins with our own people through training, career development, and a supportive culture ‚Äì empowering them to deliver outstanding service. We know that when our people thrive, they create spaces where our customers‚Äô employees and businesses thrive too.

ISS is a Place to Be You.

Be who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.

Become more. Become ISS.

ISS seeks to BE a place of belonging and CREATE places where every person is welcomed, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. Places where people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves.

Title: Data Science Associate (Fashion)
Description:
Who We Are




We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS‚Äô eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




Opportunity to accelerate the pace of digitalization through advanced technology, business intelligence, and analytics.
Driving high-impact insights enhancing decision making across the entire organization.
Interaction with senior business leaders on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team




What you will do




Conduct advanced data analysis focused on omnichannel customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales effectiveness across digital and physical touchpoints (specific for our team).
Translate business problems into analytical solutions, from requirement gathering to model deployment and monitoring.
Build, deploy, and maintain machine learning models (e.g. churn, CLV, segmentation, personalization) using modern MLOps frameworks (e.g. MLflow, GitL).
Leverage Databricks, Azure, or similar cloud infrastructure for scalable data processing and model deployment.
Use Python, PySpark, and common ML libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM, etc.) for data transformation, model development, and evaluation.
Apply statistical methods (e.g. hypothesis testing, A/B testing, confidence intervals) to validate performance and derive actionable insights.
Communicate findings and recommendations clearly through compelling storytelling and visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g. Business teams, Data Engineering, IT teams) and contribute to customer-centric strategies..
Support team development through knowledge sharing, collaboration, and participation in agile working models.




What you‚Äôll bring




3‚Äì5 years of experience in data science or advanced analytics, ideally in retail or e-commerce.
Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Proven ability to manage the full lifecycle of an ML solution ‚Äì from business understanding, data wrangling, and modelling, to production deployment and monitoring.
Hands-on experience with MLflow, Git, and MLOps frameworks.
Solid programming skills in Python, including libraries like pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, seaborn, and PySpark.
Experience with Azure (preferred) or AWS, especially in the context of Databricks, data pipelines, and model hosting.
Good understanding of data warehousing and querying using SQL.
Familiarity with statistical concepts (e.g. experiment design, hypothesis testing, p-values).
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including the ability to present technical insights to non-technical audiences.
Fluency in English (written and spoken);




Nice to have:




Experience within the retail and fashion industry.
Experience within international environments, consultancies, or a start-up environment.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Reporting Specialist - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Reporting Specialist to join our team. The purpose of this role is to directly assist the reporting team by collecting and reporting all KPIs data from Foundever Operations, Supporting Departments and Leadership.

As a Reporting Specialist, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include


Under limited supervision, prepare and maintain databases & statistical reports used in financial/quality/performance management decision-making.
Investigate and analyze data and decide upon alternatives to complete assignments.
Assemble and assess statistical information from system databases and other sources.
Independently plan, prepare and maintain business unit reports critical to organizational success/profitability and meeting client expectations.
Investigate, analyze and assess trends and campaign/brand activity.
Monitor, evaluate and assess unit productivity on a daily basis.
Communicate with the manager on a daily basis to resolve problems/issues, assess scores/trends and maximize efficiency.
Additional operations support duties as assigned.
Creation of ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù reports under short timelines
Takes personal responsibility to understand and comply with all company and client security requirements and policies.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have:


English C1 advanced level
Strong computer, communication and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access/Database skills appreciated
Power BI experience is highly valued
VBA knowledge/experience is highly valued
SQL knowledge/experience is highly valued
SAP Business Objects knowledge/experience highly valued
Data Architecture knowledge/experience is highly valued
Ability to collect and assess large sets of data, dashboard creation and KPI evaluation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, make independent decisions and solve complex problems
Strong understanding of the call center industry and operations,
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment,
Demonstrated ability to develop professional relationships and interact with all levels of internal and external clients.
Solution driven mindset
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work from our site in Porto


Education And Experience.


Minimum 1 year experience as Reporting Specialist or Real Time Analyst


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever‚Ñ¢

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.‚ÄØ

Apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work on a project focused on the evolution of third-party data ecosystems would aim to streamline the integration of new data and technologies such as data virtualization, APIs, etc., enhancing the accessibility and real-time availability of data across systems.

They would ensure high data quality and consistency across various REFERENTIALS data sources and reducing discrepancies in reporting and closing figures by performing a deep analysis on the existing data and sources and transform the processes and technologies used, including the existing REFERENTIALS. The goal is to streamline workflows, improving time to market and enabling faster and more accurate insights for better decision-making.

Main Tasks


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
Database Management (SQL)
Methodologies (Agile)
Office Pack (MS Excel)
Power BI / Tableau


Language Skills


English - 3 - Expert


Soft Skills


IT - Business/IT relationship
Analytical Ability
Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Attention to detail / rigor


Additional


University degree, or equivalent by experience, in Information Technology and/or Computer Science, Information Management, or other related fields.


Knowledge in referential data is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support the company‚Äôs internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within the company.


üí° What We're Looking For


Strong ability to collect, process, and analyze large datasets to drive business insights and decision-making.
Proficient in SQL.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau for creating interactive dashboards and visualizations to communicate complex data insights effectively.
Fluency in English and French.


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject ‚ÄúDA/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Business/Data Analyst (Finance)
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking for a Business/Data Analyst to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution‚Äôs globally.


As a Business Analyst you will work in a Agile environment and you must be able to respond quickly and work on ad hoc requests from within and across teams regarding evolutionary maintenance tasks and production support.


What you will do:

  • Gather and analyze Business Requirements for new and ongoing projects;
  • Manage and respond to support requests;
  • Write specifications and user stories according to project requirements;
  • Define the plan for implementation of requests/projects;
  • Track and report project progress.


What you are like:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst;
  • Solid knowledge in financial products and market data;
  • Proven experience in IT Business Analysis or Analytics;
  • Knowledge in mathematics and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Python and R are a plus, but not mandatory)
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies;
  • Knowledge of project management tools such as Jira and Confluence;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Ability to work in a team;
  • Good level of English ‚Äì minimum B2 (mandatory);


Why join us

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Possibility of working remotely
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • ‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)

Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.

We are waiting for you at daniela.lesco@aubay.pt.

Title: Data Science Analyst (Fashion)
Description:
Who We Are




We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS‚Äô eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What you will do




Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.




What you‚Äôll bring




1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)




Nice to have:




Experience in retail, fashion, or e-commerce industries.
Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Python, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Experis Portugal is recruiting for one of our bigger clients, that is the leader in the banking sector in Europe, with presence in more than 60 countries. This job opportunity has a permanent contract directly with our client.




Responsibilities:




Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders.







Requirements:




Masters in Mathematics, Statistics, Technology, Computer Science
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Expert)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT MICROSOFT SQL Server (Expert)
English (Fluent)
Experienced with Data Analytics ([3 - 4] years)




Job location: Porto, Portugal | Hybrid model

Please, send your CV to: Joana.Cruz@experis.pt

*Only applications submitted in English will be considered.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Operations Analyst
Description:
As a global leader in facilities services we connect people and places to make the world work better. Whether directly or indirectly, you‚Äôll play a vital role in supporting our placemakers in delivering exceptional workplace experiences for our customers. Together, we make space for people and businesses to thrive.

Want to know how a facility management company is powered by technology?

At ISS Tech Team we are investing in innovative and integrated technological solutions for the facility management industry with a tech team headquarted in Copenhagen, Warsaw and Porto. Our Porto hub is the first space dedicated specifically to software development and acts as a powerhouse where our employees test and implement products for over 40,000 clients and 350,000 placemakers around the world.

Job Role as Data Operations Analyst:

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Operations Analyst/ Data Loader who is eager to develop into a Data Operations Specialist. This role is ideal for someone passionate about data management and looking to grow their career in data operations.

Location: Porto, Portugal or Warsaw, Poland

Work type: Hybrid

What will you do:

Data Loading and Management:


Import and export data between various systems.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy during the loading process.
Maintain documentation of data loading procedures.



Data Quality and Troubleshooting:


Identify and resolve data loading issues.
Implement data quality control processes to ensure data accuracy.



Collaboration and Support:


Work closely with Integration, RPA and data teams to optimise data workflows.
Assist in the development and implementation of data governance policies.



Professional Development:


Participate in training and development programs to enhance skills in data operations.
Work towards understanding and managing data pipelines and workflow.



Who you‚Äôll work with:


Collaboration with all internal and external IT & business stakeholders both, at regional and country-level but also at global scale
Supporting operations performance in delivering best-in-class customer service
Co-ordinating and aligning across functional teams to ensure solution & data set up, configured and working as required.



What makes you fit:


Proficiency in data management tools and software.
Basic understanding of database structures and SQL.
Familiarity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Good problem-solving abilities.
Eagerness to learn and develop skills in data operations.
Ability to adapt to new technologies and processes.
Ability to work collaboratively with different teams.
Strong communication skills in English.



Nice to have skills:


Experience with data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python).
Basic knowledge of data governance and compliance standards.
Previous experience in a data-related role is a plus.



Why ISS:

At ISS, we are more than just a service provider of cleaning, food, workplace and technical services, we are a partner in our customers‚Äô success. By creating exceptional service moments and transforming workplaces into spaces where employees feel valued, engaged and productive, we enhance productivity and help our customers to attract talent and grow their businesses. This begins with our own people through training, career development, and a supportive culture ‚Äì empowering them to deliver outstanding service. We know that when our people thrive, they create spaces where our customers‚Äô employees and businesses thrive too.

ISS is a Place to Be You.

Be who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.

Become more. Become ISS.

ISS seeks to BE a place of belonging and CREATE places where every person is welcomed, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. Places where people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves.

HTML:
As a global leader in facilities services we connect people and places to make the world work better. Whether directly or indirectly, you‚Äôll play a vital role in supporting our placemakers in delivering exceptional workplace experiences for our customers. Together, we make space for people and businesses to thrive.

Want to know how a facility management company is powered by technology?

At ISS Tech Team we are investing in innovative and integrated technological solutions for the facility management industry with a tech team headquarted in Copenhagen, Warsaw and Porto. Our Porto hub is the first space dedicated specifically to software development and acts as a powerhouse where our employees test and implement products for over 40,000 clients and 350,000 placemakers around the world.

Job Role as Data Operations Analyst:

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Operations Analyst/ Data Loader who is eager to develop into a Data Operations Specialist. This role is ideal for someone passionate about data management and looking to grow their career in data operations.

Location: Porto, Portugal or Warsaw, Poland

Work type: Hybrid

What will you do:

Data Loading and Management:

  • Import and export data between various systems.
  • Ensure data integrity and accuracy during the loading process.
  • Maintain documentation of data loading procedures.


Data Quality and Troubleshooting:

  • Identify and resolve data loading issues.
  • Implement data quality control processes to ensure data accuracy.


Collaboration and Support:

  • Work closely with Integration, RPA and data teams to optimise data workflows.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of data governance policies.


Professional Development:

  • Participate in training and development programs to enhance skills in data operations.
  • Work towards understanding and managing data pipelines and workflow.


Who you‚Äôll work with:

  • Collaboration with all internal and external IT & business stakeholders both, at regional and country-level but also at global scale
  • Supporting operations performance in delivering best-in-class customer service
  • Co-ordinating and aligning across functional teams to ensure solution & data set up, configured and working as required.


What makes you fit:

  • Proficiency in data management tools and software.
  • Basic understanding of database structures and SQL.
  • Familiarity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Good problem-solving abilities.
  • Eagerness to learn and develop skills in data operations.
  • Ability to adapt to new technologies and processes.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with different teams.
  • Strong communication skills in English.


Nice to have skills:

  • Experience with data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python).
  • Basic knowledge of data governance and compliance standards.
  • Previous experience in a data-related role is a plus.


Why ISS:

At ISS, we are more than just a service provider of cleaning, food, workplace and technical services, we are a partner in our customers‚Äô success. By creating exceptional service moments and transforming workplaces into spaces where employees feel valued, engaged and productive, we enhance productivity and help our customers to attract talent and grow their businesses. Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Science Associate (Fashion)
Description:
Who We Are




We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS‚Äô eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




Opportunity to accelerate the pace of digitalization through advanced technology, business intelligence, and analytics.
Driving high-impact insights enhancing decision making across the entire organization.
Interaction with senior business leaders on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team




What you will do




Conduct advanced data analysis focused on omnichannel customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales effectiveness across digital and physical touchpoints (specific for our team).
Translate business problems into analytical solutions, from requirement gathering to model deployment and monitoring.
Build, deploy, and maintain machine learning models (e.g. churn, CLV, segmentation, personalization) using modern MLOps frameworks (e.g. MLflow, GitL).
Leverage Databricks, Azure, or similar cloud infrastructure for scalable data processing and model deployment.
Use Python, PySpark, and common ML libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM, etc.) for data transformation, model development, and evaluation.
Apply statistical methods (e.g. hypothesis testing, A/B testing, confidence intervals) to validate performance and derive actionable insights.
Communicate findings and recommendations clearly through compelling storytelling and visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g. Business teams, Data Engineering, IT teams) and contribute to customer-centric strategies..
Support team development through knowledge sharing, collaboration, and participation in agile working models.




What you‚Äôll bring




3‚Äì5 years of experience in data science or advanced analytics, ideally in retail or e-commerce.
Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Proven ability to manage the full lifecycle of an ML solution ‚Äì from business understanding, data wrangling, and modelling, to production deployment and monitoring.
Hands-on experience with MLflow, Git, and MLOps frameworks.
Solid programming skills in Python, including libraries like pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, seaborn, and PySpark.
Experience with Azure (preferred) or AWS, especially in the context of Databricks, data pipelines, and model hosting.
Good understanding of data warehousing and querying using SQL.
Familiarity with statistical concepts (e.g. experiment design, hypothesis testing, p-values).
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including the ability to present technical insights to non-technical audiences.
Fluency in English (written and spoken);




Nice to have:




Experience within the retail and fashion industry.
Experience within international environments, consultancies, or a start-up environment.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Reporting Specialist - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Reporting Specialist to join our team. The purpose of this role is to directly assist the reporting team by collecting and reporting all KPIs data from Foundever Operations, Supporting Departments and Leadership.

As a Reporting Specialist, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include


Under limited supervision, prepare and maintain databases & statistical reports used in financial/quality/performance management decision-making.
Investigate and analyze data and decide upon alternatives to complete assignments.
Assemble and assess statistical information from system databases and other sources.
Independently plan, prepare and maintain business unit reports critical to organizational success/profitability and meeting client expectations.
Investigate, analyze and assess trends and campaign/brand activity.
Monitor, evaluate and assess unit productivity on a daily basis.
Communicate with the manager on a daily basis to resolve problems/issues, assess scores/trends and maximize efficiency.
Additional operations support duties as assigned.
Creation of ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù reports under short timelines
Takes personal responsibility to understand and comply with all company and client security requirements and policies.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have:


English C1 advanced level
Strong computer, communication and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access/Database skills appreciated
Power BI experience is highly valued
VBA knowledge/experience is highly valued
SQL knowledge/experience is highly valued
SAP Business Objects knowledge/experience highly valued
Data Architecture knowledge/experience is highly valued
Ability to collect and assess large sets of data, dashboard creation and KPI evaluation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, make independent decisions and solve complex problems
Strong understanding of the call center industry and operations,
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment,
Demonstrated ability to develop professional relationships and interact with all levels of internal and external clients.
Solution driven mindset
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work from our site in Porto


Education And Experience.


Minimum 1 year experience as Reporting Specialist or Real Time Analyst


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever‚Ñ¢

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.‚ÄØ

Apply today!

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
PwC Services Portugal (PSP) is a joint venture between PwC Luxembourg and PwC Portugal, serving as an integral extension of PwC Luxembourg. Our growing team operates as an acceleration center supporting PwC Luxembourg‚Äôs clients. Leveraging a unique pool of talented professionals based in Matosinhos, our operating model ensures scalability, consistency, and quality in service delivery by integrating seamlessly into PwC Luxembourg‚Äôs operations and addressing talent attraction challenges sustainably.

The role ‚Äì IT Business Analyst

Responsibilities

We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven IT Business Analyst to join our team. Your main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Assist in the development, implementation, and optimization of IT practices and processes to support organizational objectives
Provide analytical support to IT practice leaders in defining and improving business requirements, workflows, and performance metrics
Gather, analyze, and document business requirements, ensuring alignment with the organization‚Äôs goals and IT strategies
Work with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize IT service delivery models, ensuring client satisfaction and operational efficiency
Conduct data analysis, create reports, and present findings to help drive business decisions and continuous improvement.


Your profile


BSc or MSc in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field
Basic understanding of IT service delivery, project management, and business process analysis
Proficiency in data analysis, with experience using tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Basic knowledge of ITIL or other IT management frameworks
Familiarity with service management platforms such as ServiceNow
Fluent in both written and spoken English and Portuguese.


We believe you have what it takes. Are you ready to join our ‚Äúcommunity of solvers‚Äù?

Be a part of The New Equation.
